exabundo: <entryFree id="n16520" type="main" key="exa^bundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ăbundo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n16520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to abound exceedingly</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">immensarum divitiarum copiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Avar. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exabusus: <entryFree id="n16521" type="hapax" key="exa^bu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ăbūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [abutor], <sense id="n16521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abusing greatly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 7, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exacerbatio: <entryFree id="n16522" type="main" key="exa^cerba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exăcerbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exacerbo</etym>, <sense id="n16522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exasperation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> de Schem. 11, p. 274</bibl>: peccatorum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">because of</hi>, Salv. Gub. Dei, 4, 7.—</sense><sense id="n16522.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., of the stirring of divine anger by the Jews in the wilderness, <hi rend="ital">the provocation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Hebr. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exacerbatrix: <entryFree id="n16523" type="main" key="exa^cerba_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exăcerbātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who exasperates</hi>, Salv. Gub. Dei, 3, 9.</sense></entryFree>
exacerbesco: <entryFree id="n16524" type="hapax" key="exa^cerbesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ăcerbesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n16524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become exasperated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">angry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est tam mitis quin exacerbescat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 327, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exacerbo: <entryFree id="n16525" type="main" key="exa^cerbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ăcerbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (not anteAug.). <sense id="n16525.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To exasperate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make angry; to grieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afflict</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut recenti aliqua ira exacerbarentur animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:46" default="NO" valid="yes">46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 18</bibl>; 8, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:9:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 9, 24 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16525.1" n="II" level="1"> In jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">to aggravate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi> a punishment: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen verbis impiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 29, 1</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimine majestatis facto maxime exacerbatur in milites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 4, 7, § 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exacervans: <entryFree id="n16526" type="hapax" key="exa^cervans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ăcervans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [acervo], <sense id="n16526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heaping up exceedingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exacesco: <entryFree id="n16527" type="main" key="exa^cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ăcesco</orth>, <itype>ăcŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n16527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become sour</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:17:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exacon: <entryFree id="n16528" type="foreign" key="exa^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exăcon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n16528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Gallic name of the herb</hi> centaureum (<hi rend="ital">centaury</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 31, § 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exacte: <entryFree id="n16529" type="main" key="exacte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exacte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n16529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precisely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurately</hi>, v. exigo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exactio: <entryFree id="n16530" type="main" key="exacti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exigo</etym>. * <sense id="n16530.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A driving out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expelling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(regum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 37</bibl></cit> (perh. only on account of the preceding exactis regibus).—</sense><sense id="n16530.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A demanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exacting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">requisition.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16530.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in exhibendis operariis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotidiana, operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">the supervision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi> of a public work; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">exactor, II. A.: operum publicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:20:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 20, 51</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n16530.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a calling in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collecting</hi> of debts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:20:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 20, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:8:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 8, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 4</bibl></cit>, <cb n="EXAE" /> 28 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16530.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a tax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impost</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbissima capitum atque ostiorum,</quote> <trans><tr>poll and hearth tax</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: publicae, Asin. Pol. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">illicitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 51</bibl></cit>; and: exactionum coactor (pater Horatii), Suet. Vita Hor.—</sense><sense id="n16530.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A finishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exactor: <entryFree id="n16531" type="main" key="exactor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exactor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.; cf. also exactio</etym>. * <sense id="n16531.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A driver-out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expeller</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regum (Junii Valeriique),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16531.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A demander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactor</hi> (cf.: redemptor, manceps, magister; also: publicanus, portitor). </sense><sense id="n16531.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: operis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an overseer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superintendent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enforcer</hi> of any kind of labor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 37</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">assiduus studiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">asper recte loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestissimus sermonis Latini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicii,</quote> <trans><tr>an executioner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 37</bibl>, and 3, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:12:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 12, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16531.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a collector of taxes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tax gatherer</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 25, 9</bibl>; Firm. 4, 3 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 18, § 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">or of other debts due the state,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:33" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 22, 1, 33</bibl></cit>. (Not in Cic.; but cf. exactio.)</sense></entryFree>
exactrix: <entryFree id="n16532" type="hapax" key="exactrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exactrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exactor</etym>, <sense id="n16532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who demands</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rescriptorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 135" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 135</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exactus: <entryFree id="n16533" type="main" key="exactus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exigo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16534" type="hapax" key="exactus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exactus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exigo</etym>, <sense id="n16534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sending off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>disposal</tr>, <tr>sale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exacuo: <entryFree id="n16535" type="main" key="exa^cu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ăcŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make very sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sharpen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make pointed</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16535.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferramenta cote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 12, § 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:146" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 14, 41, § 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallos furcasque bicornes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metas in angustissimas vertices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua in leve fastigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 124</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16535.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of taste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aceto exacuendo,</quote> <trans><tr>for making pungent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 30, § 93</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the sight: aciem oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 11, 59, § 99</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">visum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16535.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16535.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi mucronem aliquem tribunitium exacuisset in nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cum animus) exacuerit illam ut oculorum sic ingenii aciem ad bona diligenda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 50, § 127</bibl></cit>: morbos, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to aggravate</hi>, Col. poët. 10, 392.— </sense><sense id="n16535.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to sharpen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quicken mentally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encourage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim cohortere et exacuas Cluatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem (opp. deterrere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad amorem immortalitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos in bella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> A P. 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem varia ad conamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:142" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 142</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">palatum (sapor),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 1, 10, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exacutio: <entryFree id="n16536" type="hapax" key="exa^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exăcūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exacuo</etym>, <sense id="n16536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sharpening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pointing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exadversum: <entryFree id="n16537" type="main" key="exadversum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-adversum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vors-</orth>) and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-adversus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vors-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> and <sense id="n16537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">praep.</hi> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> from opposite; hence, <hi rend="ital">over against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vis-a\-vis.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16537.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud ipsum lacum est pistrilla, et exadversum fabrica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video exadvorsum Pistoclerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea sita erat exadvorsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque earum locum bina castra exadversum constituta erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 40</bibl></cit> Roth; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 353</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 72</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exadvorsum ei loco Tonstrina erat quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samos est exadversum Mileto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 350, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 284, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16537.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Praep.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: ara Aio Loquenti exadversus eum locum consecrata est, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 45, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exadversum Athenas classem suam constituerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Thras. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 48</bibl>. Cf. Hand, Turs. II. pp. 662-664.</sense></entryFree>
exadvocatus: <entryFree id="n16538" type="hapax" key="exadvo^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-advŏcātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has been an advocate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ex-advocate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 22:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 22, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exaedificatio: <entryFree id="n16539" type="hapax" key="exaedi^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-aedĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exaedifico</etym>, <sense id="n16539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completion of an edifice;</hi> trop. of an oration: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa autem exaedificatio posita est in rebus et verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:15:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 15, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 4, § 15.</sense></entryFree>
exaedifico: <entryFree id="n16540" type="main" key="exaedi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-aedĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n16540.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To finish building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to build up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construct</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n16540.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: oppidum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cb n="EXAG" /> Capitolium (with efficere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos et villas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib. 30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 30, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc mundum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16540.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne graveris exaedificare id opus, quod instituisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 164</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suam incohatam ignaviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 95</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n16540.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To turn out of doors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ex his aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exaequatio: <entryFree id="n16541" type="main" key="exaequa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exaequātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exaequo</etym>, <sense id="n16541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an equalling.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n16541.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a levelling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 95</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">concr.,</quote> <trans><tr>a level</tr>, <tr>a plane</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16541.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a levelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an equality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc ipsam exaequationem non fero (cf., shortly before: aequato omnium cultu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 4, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exaequo: <entryFree id="n16542" type="main" key="exaequo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-aequo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n16542.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make even</hi> or <hi rend="ital">level with</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n16542.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">inferior pars (ex transtillis) sub aqua exaequanda, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: tumulos tumulis exaequabant, Auct. B. Hisp. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n16542.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum auro expendetur, argentum argento exaequabitur,</quote> <trans><tr>shall be balanced</tr>, <tr>compensated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 43</bibl></cit>.—Freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n16542.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to place on a level</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard as equal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to equal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ii, qui sunt in amicitiae conjunctionisque necessitudine superiores, exaequare se cum inferioribus debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: neminem secum dignitate, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 18, 25</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus miles tironi liber voloni sese exaequari sineret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 35, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:38" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos caelo (victoria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta dictis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to relate the events with historic accuracy just as they occurred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 2</bibl></cit> Kritz.: <cit><quote lang="la">uti militibus exaequatus cum imperatore labos volentibus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 100, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hanc regulam omnem vitam tuam exaequa,</quote> <trans><tr>conform</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnia jura pretio exaequasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">certamina belli ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16542.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To equal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be equal to</hi> any one; with <case>acc.</case> (cf. aequo): <cit><quote lang="la">ut longitudo aut plenitudo harum (syllabarum) multitudinem alterius assequatur et exaequet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 20, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetricas Sabinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 8, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exaeresimus: <entryFree id="n16543" type="main" key="exaere^si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exaerĕsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)caire/simos</foreign>, <sense id="n16543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be omitted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taken out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod suos dies mensisque congruere volunt ... non numquam eximant unum aliquem diem ex mense: quos illi exairesimos dies nominant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52</bibl></cit>. § 129.</sense></entryFree>
exaestuatio: <entryFree id="n16544" type="main" key="exaestu^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exaestŭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exaestuo</etym>, <sense id="n16544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boiling up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fermentation</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n16544.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16544.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 464, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exaestuo: <entryFree id="n16545" type="main" key="exaestu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-aestŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n16545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to boil up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foam up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferment</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. period; in Cic. and Caes. not at all). </sense><sense id="n16545.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neut.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16545.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16545.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">exaestuat mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda ima verticibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetna fundo imo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 577</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bitumen e terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus in fossas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16545.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to effervesce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glow</hi> with heat: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptus torrenti calore solis exaestuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut exaestuarat,</quote> <trans><tr>had overheated himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16545.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens exaestuat irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:798" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 798</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 623</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 559</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:297" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 297</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor exaestuat intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:63" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ignis (amoris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:867" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 867</bibl></cit>; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates magno igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 173</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16545.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to boil up with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhale</hi> (very rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">hos igitur tellus omnes exaestuat aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:816" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 816</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1137</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exaggeranter: <entryFree id="n16546" type="main" key="exagge^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exaggĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n16546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">copiously</hi>, v. exaggero <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> * 1.</sense></entryFree>
exaggeratio: <entryFree id="n16547" type="main" key="exagge^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exaggĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exaggero</etym>, <sense id="n16547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heaping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">raising up.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n16547.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> concr., in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (al. aggerationes).—</sense><sense id="n16547.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">elevation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exaltation</hi> (very seldom); amplitudinem et quasi quandam exaggerationem quam altissimam animi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqua speciosa orationis,</quote> <trans><tr>cumulation</tr>, <tr>exaggeration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. ib. § 16.</sense></entryFree>
exaggerator: <entryFree id="n16548" type="hapax" key="exagge^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exaggĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who increases</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an enlarger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Eustoch. 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exaggero: <entryFree id="n16549" type="main" key="exagge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-aggĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to raise a mound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dam</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">dike; to heap up</hi> (class.; cf.: acervo, coacervo, cumulo, aggero). </sense><sense id="n16549.1" n="I" level="1"> <pb n="672" /> <cb n="EXAG" /> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggesta humo planitiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clivum super capita columnarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 14, 21, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum operibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to surround with ramparts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluribus stramentis exaggerandum est aviarium,</quote> <trans><tr>to be abundantly filled</tr>, <tr>supplied</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16549.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to enlarge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase by heaping up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem familiarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 92</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">magnas opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16549.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: hic alteri alteris mortem morti exaggerabant, <hi rend="ital">they mutually heaped up death upon death</hi>, Auct. B. Hisp. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n16549.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to exalt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amplify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exaggerate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est ad exaggerandam et amplificandam orationem accommodatius, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio nimis alta et exaggerata (opp. humilis et abjecta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:192" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 59, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi exaggerata altius oratio (with elatio et altitudo orationis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 17, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanitatem parricidii vi orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam nostram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus excelsus et altus et virtutibus exaggeratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Xenocrates exaggerans tanto opere virtutem, extenuans cetera et abiciens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:18:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctae exaggerataeque fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventam alicujus honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:129:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 129, 2</bibl></cit>. Hence, * </sense><sense id="n16549.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">exaggĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">with many words</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Carn. Chr. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16549.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">exaggĕrā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">cumulated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heightened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevated</hi> (very seldom): <cit><quote lang="la">exaggerata verborum volubilitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 124, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 25</bibl>; cf. ib. § 9.</sense></entryFree>
exagitatio: <entryFree id="n16550" type="main" key="exa^gi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exăgĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exagito</etym>, <sense id="n16550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disturbance</hi> (late Lat.): mentis, Acr. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 208</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exagitator: <entryFree id="n16551" type="hapax" key="exa^gi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exăgĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exagito, II. B. 1.</etym>, <sense id="n16551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who severely blames</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a censurer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rhetorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 13, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exagito: <entryFree id="n16552" type="main" key="exa^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ăgĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive out of its position</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place; to stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16552.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very seldom): <cit><quote lang="la">ut quicquid faecis subsederit exagitet, et in summum reducat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis (venti) exagitata foras erumpitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 583</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustra ferarum Venatu,</quote> <trans><tr>to disturb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:553" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepus hic aliis exagitandus erit,</quote> <trans><tr>to rouse</tr>, <tr>start</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 662</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 131, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16552.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rouse up</hi> (qs. like a wild beast), <hi rend="ital">to disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persecute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16552.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">insectandis exagitandisque nummariis judicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">permulti sedes suas patrias, istius injuriis exagitati, reliquerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Suevis complures annos exagitati bello premebantur et agricultura prohibebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at omnes di exagitent me, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:141" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exagitari verberibus Furiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos flagitium, egestas, conscius animus exagitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus vulgi rumoribus exagitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam seditionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 51:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 51, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16552.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16552.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To scold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rail at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attack violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">criticise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satirize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rally</hi> (cf.: objurgo, improbo, increpo, vitupero, calumnior, reprehendo; <cit><quote lang="la">peto, incuso, etc.): hi omnes convicio L. Lentuli consulis correpti exagitabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum etiam Demosthenes exagitetur ut putidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventi sunt, qui hanc dicendi exercitationem exagitarent atque contemnerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rebus palam a consularibus exagitatis et in summam invidiam adductis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exagitabantur omnes ejus fraudes atque fallaciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36, 101</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod apud Lucilium scite exagitat in Albucio Scaevola, quam lepide lexeis compostae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 44, 149</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16552.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coepere (tribuni) senatum criminando plebem exagitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 38, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vulgum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 73, 5</bibl></cit>.—In a good sense: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus disputationibus et exagitatus maxime orator est et adjutus,</quote> <trans><tr>incited</tr>, <tr>urged onwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—Of abstract objects: <cit><quote lang="la">in tali tempore tanta vis hominis leniunda quam exagitanda videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16552.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi> the passions themselves: ne et meum maerorem exagitem et te in eundem luctum<cb n="EXAM" />  vocem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 7, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">tristes curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furores immiti corde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exagium: <entryFree id="n16553" type="main" key="exa^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exăgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ex-ago; cf. examen, II.</etym>, <sense id="n16553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weighing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weight; a balance</hi> (late Lat.), Theod. et Val. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:25" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3166</bibl>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">*)eca/giov</foreign> pensatio; <foreign lang="greek">e)cagia/zw</foreign> examino, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
exagoga: <entryFree id="n16554" type="greek" key="exa^go_ga^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exăgōgă</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)cagwgh/</foreign> (pure Lat. evectio), <sense id="n16554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exportation</hi> of goods, <hi rend="ital">export</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum exagogae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: Exagogen evectionem, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=80:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 80, 15</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
exalapo: <entryFree id="n16555" type="main" key="exa^la^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ălăpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to box on the ears</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exalapandus et flagellandus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> in Psa. 49, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exalbesco: <entryFree id="n16556" type="main" key="exalbesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-albesco</orth>, <itype>bŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n16556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become white.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16556.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rarely), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 12</bibl>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n16556.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn pale</hi> from fright, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:58:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 58, 218</bibl>; and in Fin. 5, 11, 31; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exalbidus: <entryFree id="n16557" type="main" key="exalbi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-albĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n16557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">whitish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">white</hi> (repeatedly in Pliny): <cit><quote lang="la">rami (arboris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 39, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia urticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 19, 112, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 22, § 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exalbo: <entryFree id="n16558" type="main" key="exalbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-albo</orth>, no <sense id="n16558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>albus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make white</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exalburnatus: <entryFree id="n16559" type="main" key="exalburna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-alburnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alburnum</etym>, <sense id="n16559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deprived of the alburnum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 204</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exaltatio: <entryFree id="n16560" type="main" key="exalta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exaltātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exalto</etym>. <sense id="n16560.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Exaltation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevation</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab exaltatione tua dispersae sunt gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 33, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n16560.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughtiness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non congruit professoribus humilitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exaltative: <entryFree id="n16561" type="main" key="exalta_ti_ve"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exaltātīve</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in an exalted state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under inspiration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propheta se convertit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 9, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exalto: <entryFree id="n16562" type="main" key="exalto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-alto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>altus</etym> (postAug.; mostly eccl. Lat.). <sense id="n16562.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exalt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus alia exaltat, alia submittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3</bibl></cit> prooem.: <cit><quote lang="la">TERMINOS VETVSTATE COLLAPSOS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 748</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 555: <cit><quote lang="la">solium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 14, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16562.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exaltare, Deus,</quote> <trans><tr>be praised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 56, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 13, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16562.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To deepen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fodiunt (sulcos) et exaltant in tres pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem ablaqueationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exaluminatus: <entryFree id="n16563" type="hapax" key="exa^lu_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ălūmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alumen</etym>, <sense id="n16563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the color of alum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uniones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
examarico: <entryFree id="n16564" type="main" key="exa^ma_ri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ămārĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to imbitter exceedingly</hi>: doloribus [Hilar.] Anon. in Job, 2, p. 137.</sense></entryFree>
exambio: <entryFree id="n16565" type="main" key="exambi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ambĭo</orth>, <itype>ii, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n16565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n16565.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neut.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go round asking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soliciting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Martyras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16565.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicit</hi> a person: <cit><quote lang="la">viros, mulierculas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. ad Julian. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragium tui favoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 7:49" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 7, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exambita regia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
examen: <entryFree id="n16566" type="main" key="exa_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-āmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for ex-agmen, from ex and ago; cf. contamino and contagies, flamen and flagrare</etym>. <sense id="n16566.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A multitude issuing forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flying out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a swarm.</hi> Primarily and class. of a <hi rend="ital">swarm</hi> of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">res rusticae laetae sunt tum pecudum pastu, apium examinibus, florum omnium varietate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">apium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 44, 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 33</bibl> et saep.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:29" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4" default="NO">9, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 452</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">103</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16566.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a multitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swarm</hi> (freq. only after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">locustarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullorum (arboris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:26:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 26, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 25, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vernarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:65" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">servorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Harusp. Resp. 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graium vatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:284" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stuprorum (i. e. feminarum stupratarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32:41" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32, 41</bibl></cit> (3, 30, 41 M.) et saep.—In late Lat. even of abstract things: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 46</bibl></cit>: maerorum, id. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilationum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 30, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16566.2" n="II" level="1"> A means of examining; hence, <hi rend="ital">the tongue of a balance</hi> (very rare): examen est ligula vel lignum, quod mediam hastam ad pondera adaequanda tenet, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=80:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 80, 14</bibl>: <cb n="EXAN" /> Juppiter ipse duas aequato examine lances Sustinet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 725</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 12, 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16566.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a weighing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consideration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">examenve improbum in illa Castiges trutina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 552</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:203" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 203</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
examinate: <entryFree id="n16567" type="main" key="exa_mi^na_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exāmĭnātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n16567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considerately</hi>, v. examino, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
examinatio: <entryFree id="n16568" type="main" key="exa_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exāmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>examino</etym>. <sense id="n16568.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, i. q. libratio, <hi rend="ital">an equipoise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equilibrium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16568.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a weighing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examination</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:14:1" default="NO">47, 14, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
examinator: <entryFree id="n16569" type="main" key="exa_mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exāmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n16569.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a weigher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 6, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16569.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an examiner</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 9</bibl>; Aug. contr. Cresc. 3, 73.</sense></entryFree>
examinatorius: <entryFree id="n16570" type="hapax" key="exa_mi^na_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exāmĭnātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to an examination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">martyria fidei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
examinatrix: <entryFree id="n16571" type="main" key="exa_mi^na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exāmĭnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that tests</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tries</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Sanct. Virg. 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
examinatus: <entryFree id="n16572" type="main" key="exa_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exāmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from examino.</entryFree>
examino: <entryFree id="n16573" type="main" key="exa_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exāmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n16573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [examen]. * </sense><sense id="n16573.1" n="I" level="1"> (acc. to examen, I.).— <hi rend="ital">Neut.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to form swarms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swarm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">examinant alvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16573.2" n="II" level="1"> (acc. to examen, II.). </sense><sense id="n16573.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16573.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(aër) tamquam paribus examinatus ponderibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: ad certum pondus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 12, 4</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n16573.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neut.</hi>: alicui, <hi rend="ital">to be in equilibrium with</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to counterbalance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterpoise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16573.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">try</hi>, <hi rend="ital">test</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non aurificis statera, sed quadam populari trutina examinari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 159</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia verborum momentis, non rerum ponderibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid suis ponderibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligenter verborum omnium pondera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">emendate loquendi regulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">juncturam syllabarum longarum et brevium aurium mensura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:18:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Parrhasius) examinasse subtilius lineas traditur (shortly after: circumscripsit omnia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 4</bibl></cit> Spald.: male verum examinat omnis Corruptus judex, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 8</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of judicial examination,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:58" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=43" default="NO">33, 7, 12, § 43</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">exāmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">tried</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">careful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoughtful</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">examinatissima diligentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 7:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 7, 6</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exāmĭnātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considerately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">credere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">examinatius deliberare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
examplexor: <entryFree id="n16574" type="hapax" key="examplexor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-amplexor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n16574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clasp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embrace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
examurco: <entryFree id="n16575" type="hapax" key="exa^murco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ămurco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>amurca</etym>.Prop., <sense id="n16575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cleanse from dregs.</hi>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of moisture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dry</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 149, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
examussim: <entryFree id="n16576" type="main" key="exa^mussim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ămussim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>amussis, by the rule, i. e.</etym>, <sense id="n16576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precisely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfectly</hi> (= ad amussim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:34" default="NO">20, 1, 34</bibl>); cf. Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 178</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 9, 6 sq.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">p. 80, 19 Müll. (ante- and post-class.): aedes Factae probe, examussim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem examussim disputare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 128, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nae ista edepol ... examussim est optuma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 213</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl>, p. 271; cf. Hand, Turs. II. p. 664.</sense></entryFree>
exancillatus: <entryFree id="n16577" type="hapax" key="exancilla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ancillātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [ancillor], <sense id="n16577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving like a slave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima falsis dis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
exanclo: <entryFree id="n16578" type="main" key="exanclo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-anclo</orth> (less accurately -antlo), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (an archaic word; mostly ante-class.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 40</bibl>), <sense id="n16578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring out as a servant.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16578.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16578.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: clavum, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 29, 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16578.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi> a liquid = exhaurio: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum poculo pauxillulo saepe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich, 1, 3, 116</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: nisi patrem materno sanguine exanclando ulciscerer, i. e. <hi rend="ital">spilling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shedding</hi> = effundendo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 292, 16</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Fragm. p. 32</bibl>), exanclare, effundere, Non. ib.—</sense><sense id="n16578.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi> something (esp. a misfortune, grievance): clades impatibiles, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 292, 12</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Fragm. p. 147</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">aerumnas, labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 14" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 14</bibl></cit>: quantis cum aerumnis illum exanclavi diem, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 292, 9</bibl> (Rib. <pb n="673" /> <cb n="EXAN" /> Trag. Fragm. p. 26); cf.: tot belli annos, Cic. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> Div. 2, 30, 64 (as a translation of Hom. Il. 2, 328): o multa dictu gravia, perpessu aspera, quae corpore exanclata atque animo pertuli! id. poët. Tusc. 2, 8, 20 (translation of Soph. Trach. 1048).—In prose in Cicero (perh. only as a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> reminiscence): <cit><quote lang="la">Herculi quendam laborem exanclatum a Carneade, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 34</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n16578.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To endure to the end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhaust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum exanclavisset omnes labores, tum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 118</bibl></cit>: fere exanclavimus Tyranni saevom ingenium, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 292, 10</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Fragm. p. 171 sq.</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
exanguis: <entryFree id="n16579" type="main" key="exanguis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exanguis</orth>, v. exsanguis.</entryFree>
exanimabiliter: <entryFree id="n16580" type="hapax" key="exa^ni^ma_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ănĭmābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>exanimo</etym>, <sense id="n16580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half dead</hi> with fear or horror, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 376, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exanimalis: <entryFree id="n16581" type="main" key="exa^ni^ma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ănĭmālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n16581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. pass.</hi> (perh. only in Plaut.), <hi rend="ital">lifeless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni illum exanimalem faxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deadly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae exanimales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exanimatio: <entryFree id="n16582" type="main" key="exa^ni^ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exănĭmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exanimo</etym>. <sense id="n16582.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A depriving of breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffocating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volvarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hysterical passion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 3, 13, § 28</bibl></cit> (for which suffocatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 5, 15, § 30</bibl>, and strangulatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 15, 90, § 153</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n16582.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exanimatio metus subsequens et quasi comes pavoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cavebimus, ne in perturbationes atque exanimationes incidamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 36, 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exanimis: <entryFree id="n16583" type="main" key="exa^ni^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ănĭmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ănĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (cf. Wagner ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 8</bibl>; the latter form common in the <number>plur.</number>, of which the former has only exanimes, <case>nom.</case> and <case>acc.</case>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>anima</etym>, <sense id="n16583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lifeless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dead</hi> (mostly postAug.; not in Cic. and Caes.; cf.: inanimis, exanimatus, mortuus). </sense><sense id="n16583.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16583.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <hi rend="ital">exanimis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(columba) Decidit exanimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 517</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 481</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut exanimem labentem ex equo Scipionem vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquamdiu jacuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 728</bibl></cit>;
