<bibl default="NO">10, 721</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 438</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:11:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 11, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:8" default="NO">9, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 21, 38, § 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 33, 39, § 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 13</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 336</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidae exanimesque favillae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dead</tr>, <tr>extinguished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:418" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>calm</tr>, <tr>without wind</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16583.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <hi rend="ital">exanimus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos juvenem exanimum ... vano maesti comitamur honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem me exanimis et Martis sorte peremptis Oratis?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim exanimos ante vallum aut in amnem Rhenum proiciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus exanimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 705</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">corpus (corpora),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1273</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:45:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 45, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:10:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 484</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 149</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 444</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 8</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exănĭma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">lifeless things</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epit. 25, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16583.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">half dead with fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dismayed</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">only in form exanimis): audiit exanimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 672</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exanimo: <entryFree id="n16584" type="main" key="exa^ni^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ănĭmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n16584.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To deprive of air</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wind.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16584.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: folles, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to press together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so as to force out the air</hi>, Auct. Aetnae, 560.—</sense><sense id="n16584.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to be out of breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weakened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhausted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul fore ut duplicato cursu Caesaris milites exanimarentur et lassitudine conficerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:92:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 92, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites cursu ac lassitudine exanimati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16584.3" n="b" level="4"> Of impers. or abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">to be weakened</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vini faex) celerrime exanimatur loco non incluso condita,</quote> <trans><tr>loses its strength</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 31, § 64</bibl></cit>: nolo verba exiliter exanimata exire, <hi rend="ital">with feeble breath</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lifeless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tame</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16584.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To deprive of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n16584.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum saepe nocentes Praeterit exanimatque indignos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 243</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se taxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16584.6" n="b" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be deprived of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be killed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Epaminondas) cum gravi vulnere exanimari se videret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 30, 97</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exanimatus,</quote> <trans><tr>killed</tr>, <tr>dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1256</bibl></cit> (with exanimis); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 25, 2</bibl> and 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al. —</sense><sense id="n16584.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of life</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="EXAR" /> <hi rend="ital">alarm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">terrify greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put out of one's senses</hi> with fright, horror, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to agitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vorsor in amoris rota miser, Exanimor, feror, differor, distrahor, diripior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio haec me miseram exanimavit metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te metus exanimant judiciorum atque legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Decius torpidos somno insuper pavore exanimat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adolescentulus sic initio accusationis exanimatus sum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me exanimant et interimunt hae voces Milonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 34, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tulliae meae morbus et imbecillitas corporis me exanimat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur me querelis exanimas (= conturbas, summo maerore afficis) tuis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 178</bibl> et saep.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exanimata metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 2</bibl>: non me fefellit, sensi; <cit><quote lang="la">eo exanimatus fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 4, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 805</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:760 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 760 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
exanimus: <entryFree id="n16585" type="main" key="exa^ni^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exănĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. exanimis.</entryFree>
exanthema: <entryFree id="n16586" type="greek" key="exanthe_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exanthēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ca/nqhma</foreign>, <sense id="n16586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eruption on the skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exanthema</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 19</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 15</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
exantlo: <entryFree id="n16587" type="main" key="exantlo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exantlo</orth>, v. exanclo.</entryFree>
exaperio: <entryFree id="n16588" type="main" key="exa^pe^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ăpĕrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to open wide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw open</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">exapertae repente delubri fores, et audita major humana vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicatissimam nodositatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to undo</tr>, <tr>unloose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exaporior: <entryFree id="n16589" type="main" key="exa^po^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ăpŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n16589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be in utter perplexity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aporiati exaporiantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Aquil. Orig. in Cant. p. 305</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exapto: <entryFree id="n16590" type="hapax" key="exapto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-apto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deo coronas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 271, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exaptus: <entryFree id="n16591" type="main" key="exaptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-aptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n16591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fastened</hi> (very rare): exaptum pendere onus ingens, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 235, 7</bibl>; cf.: ex quo orbe pendeant exapta catenis tintinabula, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 92</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Fer. Als. p. 213" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Fer. Als. p. 213</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
exaquesco: <entryFree id="n16592" type="hapax" key="exa^quesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ăquesco</orth>, <itype>escĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n16592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn to water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundus tum exignescere, tum exaquescere videtur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 18, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exaratio: <entryFree id="n16593" type="main" key="exa^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exărātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exaro</etym> (late Lat.). * <sense id="n16593.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A ploughing up</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 637</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n16593.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 335</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exarchus: <entryFree id="n16594" type="greek" key="exarchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/carxos</foreign>, <sense id="n16594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a superintendent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overseer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">monasteriorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Nov. 133:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Nov. 133, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exardeo: <entryFree id="n16595" type="main" key="exarde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ardĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (eccl. Lat.). <sense id="n16595.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to burn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 16, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16595.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the feelings, <hi rend="ital">to be inflamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blaze out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in brevi ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in desideriis suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 1, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exardesco: <entryFree id="n16596" type="main" key="exardesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ardesco</orth>, <itype>arsi, arsum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n16596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, qs. to blaze out, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to kindle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take fire</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. sense and in Cic.; cf.: ardeo, ferveo, caleo, flagro, candeo, uro, etc., incendor, inflammor, etc.). </sense><sense id="n16596.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla materies tam facilis ad exardescendum est, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulphur exardescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 50, § 175</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16596.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the sun's heat: <cit><quote lang="la">exarsit dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:67:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 67, 6</bibl></cit>.—And of a fiery color: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgor carbunculi exardescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16596.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be kindled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break out</hi> (in a good and bad sense). </sense><sense id="n16596.4" n="A" level="2"> Of personal subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">exarsit iracundia ac stomacho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 4</bibl>: (Induciomarus) multo gravius hoc dolore exarsit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infestius Papirium exarsurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">graviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud secus exarsit quam Circo taurus aperto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo exarserant animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinibus indomitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni genere amplificationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 29, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hodierno die ad spem libertatis exarsimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cupiditatem libertatis recuperandae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 27, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebes ad id maxime indignatione exarsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quod exarsit adeo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites in perniciosam seditionem exarsuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 35, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 445</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 64</bibl></cit>.—Of the passion of love: in C. Silium ita exarserat (Messalina), <cb n="EXAR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16596.5" n="2" level="3"> Of impersonal and abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">immane quantum animi exarsere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 2, 53</bibl></cit> (p. 229 ed. Gerl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo exardescit sive amor, sive amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 100</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">novum atque atrox proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admirabilis quaedam benevolentiae magnitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundia exercitus in eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentia Turni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor Alcidae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 220</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:25" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 25</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">certamina inter patres plebemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta ista importunitas inauditi sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 14, § 48</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum propter multorum delicta etiam ad innocentium periculum tempus illud exarserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altercatio ex iracundia muliebri in contentionem animorum exarsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">studia in proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corinthiorum vasorum pretia in immensum exarsisse,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>had risen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus initiis in tantum admiratio haec exarserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:88:45 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 88, 45 al.</bibl></cit> (See also excandefacio and incendo.)!*? * <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: exarsus, a, um, <hi rend="ital">burned up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res vestras incendio exarsas esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 9, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exarefio: <entryFree id="n16597" type="hapax" key="exa_re^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ārĕfīo</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <sense id="n16597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. pass.</hi> [arefacio], <hi rend="ital">to dry up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become completely dry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fucus marinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 66, § 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exareno: <entryFree id="n16598" type="main" key="exareno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-areno</orth>, v. exhareno.</entryFree>
exaresco: <entryFree id="n16599" type="main" key="exa_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-āresco</orth>, <itype>rŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n16599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dry up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become completely dry</hi> (rare, but class.). </sense><sense id="n16599.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta uvida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva omnis radicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 33, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. fontes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 49, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus et stagna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae,</quote> <trans><tr>to dry up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16599.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque dum exarui ex amoenis rebus et voluptariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic omnis fetus repressus, exustusque flos siti veteris ubertatis exaruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vetustate exaruit opinio,</quote> <trans><tr>dried up</tr>, <tr>extinguished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:31:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 31, 75</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus urbanitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultas orationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 18, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exaridus: <entryFree id="n16600" type="hapax" key="exa_ri^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ārĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n16600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dried up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quite dry.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">status Judaeorum (with emortuus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exarmatio: <entryFree id="n16601" type="main" key="exarma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-armātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exarmo</etym>, <sense id="n16601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weakening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lessening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluxurarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Sing. Cler. 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exarmo: <entryFree id="n16602" type="main" key="exarmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-armo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive of arms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to disarm</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n16602.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Medos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 387</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Hel. 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16602.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16602.3" n="1" level="3"> Navem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to unrig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dismantle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 17:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:15:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 3, 15, 9</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lose the rigging</hi> of a ship: <cit><quote lang="la">et si exarmavit, tamen reliquias navigii aptat ad cursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 30:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 30, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16602.4" n="2" level="3"> (Causa pro effectu.) <hi rend="ital">To deprive of strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weaken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentem diro veneno,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to render harmless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:411" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 411</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">taurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:597" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor (terrae cingentes),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epigr. 35, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani exarmati,</quote> <trans><tr>weakened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.—</sense><sense id="n16602.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to disarm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium mater Veturia lacrimis suis exarmavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:22:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit> Duker.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nautas mirabili forma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 105, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exaro: <entryFree id="n16603" type="main" key="exa^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ăro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to plough</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dig up</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16603.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: radices, Cato. R. R. 61; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 30, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terminos (with deicere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:4:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 1, 4, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum, puerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:23:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 23, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 38, 80</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n16603.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16603.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce by tillage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum frumenti, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Zumpt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 3, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16603.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to plough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">till</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:10:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum de integro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:10:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with effodere mala,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to dig up the earth about them</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 14</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: cum rugis vetus frontem senectus exaret, <hi rend="ital">furrows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrinkles</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 4</bibl> (cf. aro).—</sense><sense id="n16603.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To write</hi>, <hi rend="ital">note</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set down</hi> something on tablets (used by Cic. only in his letters): undecimo die postquam a te discesseram, hoc literularum<pb n="674" /> <cb n="EXAU" />  exaravi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum prooemium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad te harum exemplum in codicillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">binos codicillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ipsum his versibus exaravi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">librum tertium Aesopi stilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 19, 23</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n16603.6" n="D" level="2"> Latera, <hi rend="ital">to flog severely</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exarticulatus: <entryFree id="n16604" type="hapax" key="exarti^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-artĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n16604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inarticulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irregular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus tinnitusque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exasciatus: <entryFree id="n16605" type="hapax" key="exasci^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ascĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [ascio], <sense id="n16605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hewn out;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">properly prepared</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exasperatio: <entryFree id="n16606" type="main" key="exaspe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exaspĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exaspero</etym>, <sense id="n16606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a roughness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 222" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 222</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 5, 61, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16606.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Bitterness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exasperation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 12, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exasperatrix: <entryFree id="n16607" type="hapax" key="exaspe^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exaspĕrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who irritates</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exasperates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exaspero: <entryFree id="n16608" type="main" key="exaspe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-aspĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to roughen</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n16608.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">summam cutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arterias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 48, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 6, 34, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tussim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 51, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faucium vitio exasperatur vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undas,</quote> <trans><tr>to roughen</tr>, <tr>stir up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare fluctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf. aspero).—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegida innumeris signis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to adorn with raised sculptures</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Honor. 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem saxo,</quote> <trans><tr>to sharpen</tr>, <tr>whet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:19" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16608.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to irritate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exasperate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">durati (Gallograeci) tot malis exasperatique,</quote> <trans><tr>made savage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exasperavit animos ferocia nimia Harpali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:39" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animum hoc criminum genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ligures exasperati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorem civitatis partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to incite</tr>, <tr>set on</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 143</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem verbis exasperavit,</quote> <trans><tr>exasperated</tr>, <tr>made worse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exauctoritas: <entryFree id="n16609" type="hapax" key="exaucto_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exauctōrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exauctoro</etym>, <sense id="n16609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a discharge from military service</hi>, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 35.</sense></entryFree>
exauctoro: <entryFree id="n16610" type="main" key="exaucto_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-auctōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <sense id="n16610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to discharge from service</hi> (after sixteen years of service, before the end of the usual term of twenty years, i. e. before the regular missio; see missio. This discharge was either an honorable one or a punishment. The honorably discharged soldiers remained four years in the army as a separate corps under a vexillum, with peculiar privileges; cf. mitto, dimitto). </sense><sense id="n16610.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n16610.2" n="A" level="2"> Of an honorable discharge (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes milites exauctorati domum dimitterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:20" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 1</bibl>; 36, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 41, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites licentia sola se, ubi velint, exauctorent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 34, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16610.3" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to dismiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cashier</hi> on account of a crime = dimittere ignominiae causa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:2:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 2, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vitell. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 5</bibl>; cf. Dict. of Antiq. p. 638 a.—* </sense><sense id="n16610.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba exauctorata a sequenti aetate repudiataque,</quote> <trans><tr>discarded</tr>, <tr>obsolete</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exaudibilis: <entryFree id="n16611" type="main" key="exaudi_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exaudībĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exaudio</etym>, <sense id="n16611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be heard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">listened to</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Sol. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Sol. 1, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n16611.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Giving ear to requests</hi>, <hi rend="ital">listening</hi>, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:248" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 248</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exaudio: <entryFree id="n16612" type="main" key="exaudi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-audĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n16612.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perceive clearly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Nec satis exaudiebam, nec sermonis fallebar tamen, Quae loquerentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquantulum progressus esset, subito exaudivit hinnitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 39, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 61, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:66:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 66, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 105, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 52</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 33 et saep.: maxima voce, ut omnes exaudire possint, dico semperque dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:94:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 94, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:87:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 87, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16612.1" n="II" level="1"> Less freq. in the signif. of audio. </sense><sense id="n16612.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive by hearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam multa, quae nos fugiunt in cantu, exaudiunt in eo genere exercitati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exaudi, vultusque attolle jacentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum denique saxa non exauditi rubuerunt sanguine vatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haec vix proximis exaudientibus dixerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7</bibl></cit>: fingere cinctutis non <cb n="EXCA" /> exaudita Cethegis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 50</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet has exaudiat herbas (i. e. hos cantus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 715</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16612.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hearken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">listen to; to regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum miserere precesque Supplicis exaudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:856" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 856</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 706</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 3, § 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirae exauditae ab omnibus diis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota precesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:616" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 616</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae optamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:94:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 94, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 9, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 16, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 17, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:142:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 142, 1</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16612.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To give heed to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to obey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridebit monitor non exauditus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exaudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16612.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To understand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehend</hi> = intellegere: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:10:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:99" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 45, 1, 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exauditio: <entryFree id="n16613" type="main" key="exaudi_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exaudītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exaudio, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n16613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hearkening to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">granting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio exauditione dei dignior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 21:24" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 21, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl> Chron. 33, 19.</sense></entryFree>
exauditor: <entryFree id="n16614" type="main" key="exaudi_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exaudītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who hearkens to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grants</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 35, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exaugeo: <entryFree id="n16615" type="main" key="exauge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-augĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to increase exceedingly</hi> (rare): amplius, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=193" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 193</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 270 ed. Vahlen): <cit><quote lang="la">benefacta majorum tuorum exauge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exauguratio: <entryFree id="n16616" type="hapax" key="exaugu^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exaugŭrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exauguro</etym>, <sense id="n16616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a desecrating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profaning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium sacellorum exaugurationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 55, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exauguro: <entryFree id="n16617" type="main" key="exaugu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-augŭro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to apply to profane uses a thing which has been consecrated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to desecrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profane</hi> (very rare): fana, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. NEQVITVM, p. 162, 32 Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:7:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aurel. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exauspico: <entryFree id="n16618" type="hapax" key="exauspi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-auspĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n16618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take an augury from</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ex vinculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exballisto: <entryFree id="n16619" type="hapax" key="exballisto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ballisto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ballista</etym>, a comically formed word, <sense id="n16619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put an end to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to finish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conquer with the</hi> ballista: <cit><quote lang="la">Ballionem exballistabo lepide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exbibo: <entryFree id="n16620" type="hapax" key="exbi^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exbĭbo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, = ebibo, <sense id="n16620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drink out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drink up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illic calidum exbibit in prandium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 19</bibl></cit> (Ritschl, bibit).</sense></entryFree>
exbola: <entryFree id="n16621" type="greek" key="exbo^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exbŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)kbolh/</foreign>, <sense id="n16621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of missile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weapon</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=108" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 108</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 24 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
exbures: <entryFree id="n16622" type="gloss" key="exbures"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exbures</orth> <itype>exinteratas</itype>, sive <sense id="n16622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exburae</hi>, quae exbiberunt, quasi <hi rend="ital">epotae</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=79:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 79, 11</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
excaecator: <entryFree id="n16623" type="hapax" key="excaeca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excaecātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>excaeco</etym>, <sense id="n16623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who blinds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 43" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 43</bibl> ex Homil. 50.</sense></entryFree>
excaeco: <entryFree id="n16624" type="main" key="excaeco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-caeco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make blind</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n16624.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: num ergo is excaecat nos aut orbat sensibus? etc., * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 18, 76, § 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:20:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 20, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16624.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16624.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To deprive a plant of the eyes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">buds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:45" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 175</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16624.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To stop up</hi> a river, a channel, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 272</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 4, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n16624.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To darken</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dull</hi> a bright color: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgor (argenti) excaecatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 9, 46, § 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16624.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos animosque (fama),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 141, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to render uncomely</tr>, <tr>to disfigure</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 128, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec accipies munera quae excaecant prudentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 23, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excalceo: <entryFree id="n16625" type="main" key="excalce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-calcĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-calcĭo</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (the deponent form, v. below), <sense id="n16625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take off the shoes.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16625.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">petiit, ut sibi pedes praeberet excalciandos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl></cit>.—More freq. with a personal object and in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excalciatus cursitare,</quote> <trans><tr>unshod</tr>, <tr>barefoot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:88" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 88</bibl>; cf. mid. in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque umquam aut nocte aut die excalcearetur aut discingeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:41" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and as a <hi rend="ital">verb. dep.</hi>: ut nemo se excalceatur, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 478, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16625.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of tragedians, <hi rend="ital">to relieve of the</hi> cothurni, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 23</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">excalceāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">pantomimists</hi> (opp. to the tragic actors, who wore cothurni, and the comic, who wore socci), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excaldatio: <entryFree id="n16626" type="main" key="excalda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excaldātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excaldo</etym>, <sense id="n16626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a washing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bathing in warm water</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Albin. 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
excaldo: <entryFree id="n16627" type="main" key="excaldo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-caldo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>caldus</etym>, <sense id="n16627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wash</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bathe in warm water</hi> (late Lat.), Marc. Empir. 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2 al" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
excalesco: <entryFree id="n16628" type="main" key="exca^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-călesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n16628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become warm</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
excalfacio: <entryFree id="n16629" type="main" key="excalfa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-calfăcĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n16629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <cb n="EXCE" /> <hi rend="ital">to warm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to heat</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Pliny the Elder): excalfacit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 20, 82, § 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:155" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 21, 89, § 155</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">excalfieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 7, 28, § 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 158" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 158</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus sole excalfactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:148" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 54, § 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad excalfaciendos nervos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 22, 93, § 163</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excalfactio: <entryFree id="n16630" type="hapax" key="excalfacti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excalfactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excalfacio</etym>, <sense id="n16630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a warming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heating</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excalfactorius: <entryFree id="n16631" type="main" key="excalfacto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excalfactōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">warming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heating</hi> (a Plinian word), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 72, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:105" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 64, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:152" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 13, 95, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excalfio: <entryFree id="n16632" type="main" key="excalfi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excalfīo</orth>, <sense id="n16632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> of excalfacio, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
excandefacio: <entryFree id="n16633" type="main" key="excande^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-candĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflame</hi> (perh. only in the foll. passages), trop.: excande me fecerunt cupiditate (<hi rend="ital">tmesis</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonam macelli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to enhance</tr>, <tr>raise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:2:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. exardesco and incendo.</sense></entryFree>
excandeo: <entryFree id="n16634" type="main" key="excande^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-candĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n16634.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whiten</hi>: cutem, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:107" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16634.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neut.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gleam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be bright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 3:22" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excandescentia: <entryFree id="n16635" type="main" key="excandescenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excandescentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excandesco</etym>, <sense id="n16635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nascent anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passionateness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irascibility</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 21</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
excandesco: <entryFree id="n16636" type="main" key="excandesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excandesco</orth>, <itype>dŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n16636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glow</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16636.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bitumen et sulphur additum est, excandescet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:95" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 16</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n16636.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to burn</hi>, esp. with anger: haec nullam habent vim, nisi irā excanduit fortitudo, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 43</bibl>: id postquam resciit, excanduit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 53, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">57, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in exteros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ultionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:18:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excandescet in illos aqua maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 5, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excantator: <entryFree id="n16637" type="main" key="excanta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excantātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>excanto</etym>, <sense id="n16637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a charmer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one who removes by enchantment</hi>: venatorum morsuum, Hier. in Joel Prol.</sense></entryFree>
excanto: <entryFree id="n16638" type="main" key="excanto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-canto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (excantassit = excantaverit, Tab. XII. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 7, 2</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to charm out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring out by enchantment</hi> (not in Cic. or Caes.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 102, 11</bibl>; Lucil. and Plaut. ib.; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3:49" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3, 49</bibl> (4, 2, 49 M.); * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:45" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 686</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:931" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 931</bibl>: QVI FRVGES EXCANTASSIT, i. e. <hi rend="ital">had removed them by enchantment into another field</hi>, Tab. XII. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 8, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:C. D. 8:19" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> C. D. 8, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excarnifico: <entryFree id="n16639" type="main" key="excarni^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-carnĭfĭco</orth>, no <sense id="n16639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to cut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tear any one to pieces</hi> (a rare word). </sense><sense id="n16639.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16639.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excarnificatus animus, Sen. de Ira, 3, 4: comitem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 9, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excastratus: <entryFree id="n16640" type="main" key="excastra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-castrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [castro], <sense id="n16640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emasculated.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16640.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:9:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 9, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16640.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">shelled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinapi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 9" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excaudico: <entryFree id="n16641" type="main" key="excaudi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-caudĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cōdico</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> [caudex), <sense id="n16641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weed out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">root up</hi> = exstirpare. </sense><sense id="n16641.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., Lex ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 129" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 129</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16641.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to dig round</hi>, i. q. ablaqueare: <cit><quote lang="la">ablaqueandae sunt vites, quod Itali excodicare appellant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16641.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to extirpate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">root out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvam libidinum eradicare et excaudicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excavatio: <entryFree id="n16642" type="hapax" key="exca^va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excăvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excavo</etym>, <sense id="n16642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hollowing out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excavo: <entryFree id="n16643" type="main" key="exca^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-căvo</orth>, no <sense id="n16643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to hollow out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16643.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">trullam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavernam sibi rostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 27, 43, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 33, 49, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33</bibl></cit> prooem.: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides excavant aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 14, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16643.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in mal. part., <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 51, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
