excedo: <entryFree id="n16644" type="main" key="exce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n16644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subj. perf. sync.</hi> excessis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 21</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16644.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neut.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to depart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: discedo, deficio, destituo, desero, linquo, relinquo). </sense><sense id="n16644.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16644.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, with <case>abl.</case> alone, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex istoc loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Italia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e templo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, templo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex finibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 33, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, finibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 18</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 7, 77, 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 19 al.</bibl>: ex illa circumscriptione,<pb n="675" /> <cb n="EXCE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex itinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 79 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex pugna, ex proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 33, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, more freq., pugnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 36, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:789 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 789 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 7, 80, 3; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">acio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 41, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 94, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 44, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 45, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 10, 15</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 27, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 1, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 78, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:17" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 17</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Arimino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:66:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 66, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 85 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleratā terrā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 60</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">de utero matris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be born</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">abiit, excessit, evasit, erupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excedere deos, simul ingens motus excedentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primi omnium Macedones metu excesserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Designating the terminus: <cit><quote lang="la">cave quoquam ex istoc excessis loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agro hostium in Boeotiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his tenebris in lucem illam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1</bibl></cit>. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">invictum fore donec excederet ad deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:section=27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in which sense also simply excedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:22:7:section=17" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 22, 7, § 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n16644.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16644.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To go beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overstep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rise above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overtop</hi> a certain boundary.—Of personal subjects very rarely: <cit><quote lang="la">alter in Pontum, alter usque Aegyptum excessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—More freq. of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nulla (pars) excederet extra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with eminere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes et excedentia in nubes juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16644.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To depart</hi> from life, <hi rend="ital">to decease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi> (cf. decedo): <cit><quote lang="la">sic ille cum undequadraginta annos regnavisset, excessit e vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">e vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 18, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 43, 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:262" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 75, 262</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:5:3" default="NO">5, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:6" default="NO">9, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 74</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; and simply excedere (postAug.; <cit><quote lang="la">but v. decedo excessus, I.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 13, 11, § 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:826" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 826</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 77:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 77, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16644.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16644.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (very rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">cum animus Eudemi e corpore excesserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 25, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 32, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:13 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 13 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore excedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 30, 63</bibl></cit>: ex pristina bellandi consuetudine, Auct. B. Afr. 73: palmā, <hi rend="ital">to recede from victory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to yield the victory</hi> (= decedere alicui de victoria), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 380</bibl>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n16644.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16644.10" n="a" level="4"> (Acc. to A. 2. a.) <hi rend="ital">To go beyond</hi> a certain boundary or a certain measure, <hi rend="ital">to advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to transgress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">digress</hi> (= procedere, progredi): mihi aetas ex magisterio tuo: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is postquam excessit ex ephebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit> (quoted in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 327</bibl>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut primum ex pueris excessit Archias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad patres etiam et ad publicam querimoniam excessit res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:6:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec eo anno in Africa gesta. Insequentia excedunt in eum annum, quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paululum ad enarrandum, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to digress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 29, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in fabellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 77" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res parva dictu, sed quae studiis in magnum certamen excesserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 33</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo laudis excedere, quo, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to attain that height of fame</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: tantum illa clades novitate et magnitudine excessit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">exceeded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">went beyond</hi> = eminuit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16644.11" n="b" level="4"> (Acc. to A. 2. b.) <hi rend="ital">To depart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura ex corde excessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum cupiditatum dominatus excessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:3:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam e memoria excessit, quo tempore? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi reverentia excessit animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cannaene tibi graviorque palude Maeonius Stygia lacus excessere Padusque?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have they slipped from your memory?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:35" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n16644.12" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n16644.13" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to depart from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi> a place: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 37, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 29, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57:10" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 57, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">23, 1: curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crotonem excessum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n16644.14" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go beyond</hi>, <cb n="EXCE" /> <hi rend="ital">surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi> a certain limit, <hi rend="ital">to overtop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tower above</hi> (cf. above, I. A. 2. a., and B. 2. a.): <cit><quote lang="la">nubes excedit Olympus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statura, quae justam excederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam octoginta milium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of numbers, very freq.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 3, 4, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:77 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 77 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also of age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triennium vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 67, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum aetatis centesimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 2, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of measure: laborum periculorumque modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:122" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 122 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:48 al" default="NO">8, 3, 48 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia aut aequavit praestantissimorum gloriam aut excessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeturae gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principum fastigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastigium equestre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excedente humanam fidem temeritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:51:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 51, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 21, 21, § 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 166</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">excessisse Priscum inmanitate et saevitia crimina, quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemine tantum ceteros excedente, ut ei aliquis se summitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">simple acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decretum, ne vasa auro solida ministrandis cibis fierent, etc. ... Excessit Fronto ac postulavit modum argento,</quote> <trans><tr>went beyond the proposal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 33</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">egredi relationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 38</bibl></cit>).—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo enim multitudo, unione jam excessā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excellens: <entryFree id="n16645" type="main" key="excellens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excellens</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from excello.</entryFree>
excellenter: <entryFree id="n16646" type="main" key="excellenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excellenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n16646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">excellently;</hi> v. <itype>excello</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> 1. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
excellentia: <entryFree id="n16647" type="main" key="excellentia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excellentia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excello, <pos>P. a.</pos> 1.</etym>, <sense id="n16647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">superiority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfection</hi> (<hi rend="ital">abstr.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">magna cum excellentia praestantiaque animantium reliquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi excellentia magnitudoque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">picturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 14, 49, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 82</bibl></cit>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 52: propter excellentiam, <hi rend="ital">pre-eminence</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, ut Homerus propter excellentiam commune poëtarum nomen efficit apud Graecos suum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:13:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 13, 55</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per excellentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe excellentiae quaedam sunt, qualis erat Scipionis in nostro grege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excello: <entryFree id="n16648" type="main" key="excello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cello</orth>, <itype>cellŭi, celsum, 3</itype> (also acc. to the 2d conj., <sense id="n16648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">praes. indic.</hi> excellet, Aem. Mac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 371</bibl> P., and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> excelleat, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 838</bibl> and 896 P.), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cello</etym>. </sense><sense id="n16648.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate;</hi> only: <cit><quote lang="la">recellere reclinare, et excellere in altum extollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=274:31" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 274, 31</bibl></cit>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> ib. 275, 11</bibl> Müll.; cf. the <pos>P. a.</pos> excelsus, below.—</sense><sense id="n16648.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neut.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate itself</hi> (cf.: antecello, praesto, antecedo, emineo, floreo, vigeo). </sense><sense id="n16648.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, only in the <pos>P. a.</pos> excellens, q. v. A.—</sense><sense id="n16648.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16648.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to exult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be elated</hi>: animus excellit rebus secundis, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:14" default="NO">13, 24, 14</bibl>.—Far more freq. (but not in Plaut. and Ter.; and in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> not in Aug. poets), </sense><sense id="n16648.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to be eminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to distinguish one's self</hi> for any quality above others; <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>, in a good or (less freq.) in a bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">ut is, qui dignitate principibus excellit facilitate infimis par esse videatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inter quos posset excellere, cum iis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super ceteros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante ceteros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 16</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui longe ceteris excellere pictoribus existimabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae una ceteris excellebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:18:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 18, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 216</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 13, 39 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonā famā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio scientiāque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi magnitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:59:215" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 59, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc genere virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 18, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 6, 23, § 88</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliqua arte et facultate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alia parte orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:59:215" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 59, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime in amicitiis expetendis colendisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 217</bibl> et saep.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">excellit atque eminet vis, potestas nomenque regium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:19:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 19, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 41, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 32</bibl> (with eminere) et saep. —In a bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:19:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 19, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum haec (flagitia), quae excellunt, me nosse videas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n16648.7" n="1" level="3"> <cb n="EXCE" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">excellens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">rising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overtopping.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16648.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): oppida excellentibus locis constituta, Auct. B. Hisp. 8, 4: corpore excellens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:107" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 107</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n16648.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">distinguishing himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surpassing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos rerum omnium praestantia excellentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brutus noster excellens omni genere laudis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: in omni genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 220</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus excellens in re militari gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galba fuit inter tot aequales unus excellens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:333" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 97, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura excellens atque praestans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia excellens atque singularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir excellenti providentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: excellente ingenii magnitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 33</bibl></cit> (al. excellenti and excellentis, v. Orell. ad h. l.): <cit><quote lang="la">studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchritudo muliebris formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: cygnus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 250</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">excellentia</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">exceptional instances</hi>: nec excellentia, sed quotidiana tractabo, Aus. Grat. Act. § 62.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova excellentiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil illo (sc. Alcibiade) fuisse excellentius, vel in vitiis, vel in virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excellentissima virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:99:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 99, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 56</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">excellen-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">excellently</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 1, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 45</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excellentissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 17:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 17, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16648.10" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-celsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">elevated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: celsus, editus, altus, sublimis, procerus, arduus). </sense><sense id="n16648.11" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:80:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 80, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: vertex montis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">basis (statuae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves (Ibes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudo vineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 184</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in excelsiore loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu (bovis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crura chamaeleonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 33, 51, § 120</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:70:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 70, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:33" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 6, 7, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegilops,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:135" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 49, § 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16648.12" n="b" level="4"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n16648.13" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">excelsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a height</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum Jovis in excelso collocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebus ab excelso, quantum patet, aspicit aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 165</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ab excelso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:369" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 369</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prohibebit in excelsum emicare (vitem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 184</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16648.14" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ex-celsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Highest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Most High</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">God</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:72:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 72, 11 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n16648.15" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16648.16" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te natura excelsum quendam videlicet et altum et humana despicientem genuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus homo et excelsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus excelsus magnificusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">excelso et illustri loco sita est laus tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te in excelsissimo humani generis fastigio positum, Plin. H. N. praef. § 11: species magnae excelsaeque gloriac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(orator) grandior et quodammodo excelsior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:94:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 94, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo tua in me humanitas fuerit excelsior quam in te mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 20</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excelsissimae victoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:96" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 96 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 114</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16648.17" n="(a)" level="5">, <gen>m.</gen> <hi rend="ital">plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">excelsi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the lofty;</hi> prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">excelsis multo facilius casus nocet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:162" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 162</bibl></cit> (Rib.).— </sense><sense id="n16648.18" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neut.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">excelsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">an elevated station</hi> or <hi rend="ital">position</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in excelso aetatem agere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in a high station</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 12</bibl></cit>.—Esp. (eccl. Lat.): in excelsis, <hi rend="ital">in the highest</hi>, in ascriptions of praise, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:148:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 148, 1 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n16648.19" n="2" level="3"> Esp., in the later period of the empire, <hi rend="ital">a title of high official dignitaries</hi>, e. g. of the praefectus praetorio, etc.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">excelsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">highly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loftily.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16648.20" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vitis scandit excelsius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16648.21" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in an elevated manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">highly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornat excelse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excelsius magnificentiusque et dicet et sentiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 34, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excelsissime floruit (Sparta),</quote> <trans><tr>exceedingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excelse: <entryFree id="n16649" type="main" key="excelse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excelsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>excello</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> 2. <sense id="n16649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
excelsitas: <entryFree id="n16650" type="main" key="excelsi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excelsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excelsus</etym>, <sense id="n16650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loftiness</hi>, <pb n="676" /> <cb n="EXCE" /> <hi rend="ital">height.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16650.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 64, 64, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16650.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">excelsitas animi et magnitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 5, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excelsus: <entryFree id="n16651" type="main" key="excelsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excelsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. excello <sense id="n16651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 2.</sense></entryFree>
excensio: <entryFree id="n16652" type="main" key="excensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>escendo</etym>, <sense id="n16652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a climbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 10, 11</bibl> (Madvig al. escensio).</sense></entryFree>
exceptaculum: <entryFree id="n16653" type="hapax" key="excepta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exceptācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>excepto</etym>, <sense id="n16653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a receptacle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maliloquii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
excepticius: <entryFree id="n16654" type="hapax" key="excepti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exceptīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>excipio</etym>, <sense id="n16654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">caught up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intercepted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exceptio: <entryFree id="n16655" type="main" key="excepti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exceptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restriction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limitation</hi> [good prose and very freq., esp. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n16655.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliorum, voluntatum sine ulla exceptione communitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sine (ulla) or cum exceptione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:57:172" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 57, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 5</bibl> et saep.; cf. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus imperitat nullis jam exceptionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si exceptio facit, ne liceat, ibi necesse est licere, ubi non est exceptum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt in tota lege exceptiones duae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16655.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">the exception</hi> of the defendant to the plaintiff's statements, inserted in the praetor's edict, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:116 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 116 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 37</bibl>; cf. Rein's Röm. Privatr. p. 448 sq.</sense></entryFree>
exceptiuncula: <entryFree id="n16656" type="hapax" key="excepti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exceptĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>exceptio</etym>, <sense id="n16656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small limitation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exception</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 20:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 20, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excepto: <entryFree id="n16657" type="main" key="excepto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excepto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>excipio</etym>, <sense id="n16657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catch</hi> (very rare): barbatulos nullos exceptans de piscina, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 38</bibl>; so, aliquem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: (equae) exceptant leves auras, <hi rend="ital">catch up.</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">snuff up</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 274</bibl>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: per pectora saevas Exceptat mortes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:369" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 369</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exceptor: <entryFree id="n16658" type="main" key="exceptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exceptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who catches up</hi> any thing said, i. e. who writes it down, <hi rend="ital">an amanuensis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short-hand writer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scribe</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n16658.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Firm. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi> and 12.—</sense><sense id="n16658.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in the later period of the empire, an officer in the court of chancery, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 995</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2831 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
exceptorius: <entryFree id="n16659" type="main" key="excepto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exceptōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serviceable for receiving</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: exceptorium excipulum, conceptaculum, <foreign lang="greek">e)kdoxei=on</foreign>, Gloss.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exceptōrium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a receptacle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reservoir; plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 39, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exceptus: <entryFree id="n16660" type="main" key="exceptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exceptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from excipio.</entryFree>
excerebro: <entryFree id="n16661" type="main" key="exce^re_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cĕrē^bro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> <etym>cerebrum</etym>, <sense id="n16661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive of brains</hi>, i. q. <hi rend="ital">to make senseless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:66:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 66, 3</bibl></cit>.—<mood>Part.</mood>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cerē^brā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">deprived of brains</hi>, i. q. <hi rend="ital">rendered senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupefied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excerebratus es novo vino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excerno: <entryFree id="n16662" type="main" key="excerno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cerno</orth>, <itype>crēvi, crētum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sift out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n16662.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">furfures a farina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to cleanse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 20, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caementa cribris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex captorum numero excretos Saguntinos in patriam remisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 39, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">excernere parvos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem forensem turbam excretam in quatuor tribus conjecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Part. perf. subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excreta tritici,</quote> <trans><tr>what is sifted out</tr>, <tr>the chaff</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:6" default="NO">8, 8, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16662.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16662.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To keep apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi jam excretos prohibent a matribus haedos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 398</bibl></cit> Heyne and Forbig. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n16662.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To carry off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharge</hi> (from the body): <cit><quote lang="la">venter excernit mollia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae excreturi sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
excerpo: <entryFree id="n16663" type="main" key="excerpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cerpo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>carpo</etym>, <sense id="n16663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take out.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n16663.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina pomis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 272</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16663.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16663.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pick out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">select</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum ex malis eligere minima oportere, sed etiam excerpere ex ipsis, si quid inesset boni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Off. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quisque (scriptorum) commodissime praecipere videbatur, excerpsimus,</quote> <trans><tr>made extracts</tr>, <tr>selections</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; so, verba ex Originibus Catonis, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil umquam legit, quod non excerperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 33</bibl>, <cb n="EXCI" /> 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:13" default="NO">10, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex libris qui chronici appellantur ... easque excerptiones digerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">paucos enim, qui sunt eminentissimi, excerpere in animo est,</quote> <trans><tr>to single out</tr>, <tr>make prominent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:29" default="NO">7, 1, 29</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">excerptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an extract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">selection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excerpt</hi> from a book or writing: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Gorgiā Platonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 24</bibl></cit>: Coelianum. M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 33:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 33, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16663.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leave out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">except</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim, si est facilius, eo de numero quoque est excerpendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:11:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 11, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me illorum excerpam numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu id, quod boni est, excerpis: dicis, quod mali est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16663.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To withdraw one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se consuetudini hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se vulgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excerptio: <entryFree id="n16664" type="hapax" key="excerpti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excerptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excerpo, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n16664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an extract</hi> selected from a composition, <hi rend="ital">an excerpt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excerptus: <entryFree id="n16665" type="main" key="excerptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excerptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from excerpo.</entryFree>
excervicatio: <entryFree id="n16666" type="hapax" key="excervi_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cervīcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cervicatus</etym>, <sense id="n16666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">obstinacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stubbornness</hi>, Hier. in Naum, 3; cf. cervicositas.</sense></entryFree>
excessio: <entryFree id="n16667" type="main" key="excessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excedo</etym>, <sense id="n16667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">departure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante excessionis diem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Orig. in Jerem. Hom. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; Lutat. Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:599" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 599</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excessus: <entryFree id="n16668" type="main" key="excessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excessus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>excedo, I. A. 2. and B. 2.</etym>. <sense id="n16668.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A departure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16668.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">excessus ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—Esp., a <hi rend="ital">departure</hi> from life: <cit><quote lang="la">in his esse et excessum e vita et in vita mansionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:18:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 18, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:13" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 13</bibl> prooem.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 26:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 26, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also, vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2</bibl>, ext. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">post obitum, vel potius excessum Romuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so of Romulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; once in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and freq. in post-Aug. prose excessus alone,</quote> <trans><tr>death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:3 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16668.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a leaving</hi> of the mental powers, <hi rend="ital">loss</hi> of self-possession, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/kstasis</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">in excessu mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 11, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:30:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 30, 22</bibl>.—Without mentis: <cit><quote lang="la">ego dixi in excessu meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:115:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 115, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16668.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A standing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projecting</hi> beyond a certain limit. * </sense><sense id="n16668.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">os calcis quadam parte sinuatur, quadam excessus habet,</quote> <trans><tr>projections</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montani excessus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexuosi excessus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 24, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16668.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16668.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A departing from the subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">digression</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">egressio vel (quod usitatius esse coepit) excessus, sive est extra causam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. ib. § 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 26, 9</bibl>; and in <number>plur.</number>, Plin. H. N. praef. § 12.—</sense><sense id="n16668.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A deviation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aberration</hi> from any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">minuti a pudore excessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:2:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderaminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> in Symm. 2, 990</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excetra: <entryFree id="n16669" type="main" key="exce_^tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excē^tra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. corrupted from <foreign lang="greek">e)/xidna</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n16669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a snake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serpent</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n16669.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 3 sq.</bibl>; * Cic. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> Tusc. 2, 9, 22.—</sense><sense id="n16669.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, a reproachful epithet for a bad, intriguing woman, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excidio: <entryFree id="n16670" type="main" key="exci^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excĭdĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exscindo, v. 1. excidium</etym>, <sense id="n16670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a destroying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">excidionem</hi> urbis a caedendo dictam manifestum est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=80:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 80, 9</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
excidium: <entryFree id="n16671" type="main" key="exci^di^um1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excĭdĭum</orth> (sometimes written <orth extent="full" lang="la">exscidium</orth>, as if from exscindo), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>usually referred to ex-cīdo</etym>, <sense id="n16671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demolition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subversion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi> (especially of cities, buildings, etc.), <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi> (not freq. till the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Caes. and Cic.): urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 626</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">petit urbem excidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 505</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 643</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libyae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:98:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 98, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 25</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Cretensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. p. 290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. p. 290</bibl></cit> ed. Gerl.: <cit><quote lang="la">legionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 386</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16672" type="main" key="exci^di^um2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excĭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>excĭdo</etym>, <sense id="n16672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 694</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excido: <entryFree id="n16673" type="main" key="exci^do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cĭdo</orth>, <itype>cĭdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cado</etym>, <sense id="n16673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall from</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n16673.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16673.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cb n="EXCI" /> quod (animal) cum ex utero elapsum excidit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol excidisse mihi e mundo videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladii de manibus exciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: inter manus (urna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 22; and: <cit><quote lang="la">a digitis (ansa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palinurus exciderat puppi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 339</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1164" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num qui nummi exciderunt, here, tibi, quod sic terram Obtuere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volvae excidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 21, 39, § 151</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita vinclis Excidet aut in aquas tenues dilapsus abibit,</quote> <trans><tr>will slip out of the fetters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in flumen (elephanti, sc. e rate),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Herculis pertractanti arma sagitta excidisset in pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 30, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante pedes (lingua resecta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:536" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 536</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16673.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of a lot, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi> of <hi rend="ital">come out</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut cujusque sors exciderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 42, 3</bibl></cit>;
