<cit><quote lang="la">and hence, transf.: nominibus in urnam conjectis, citari quod primum sorte nomen excidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n16673.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16673.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to fall out involuntarily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slip out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum ex ore alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vox excidit ore: Venisti tandem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 686</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantumque nefas patrio excidit ore?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 658</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus ore tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod verbum tibi non excidit, ut saepe fit, fortuito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:52" default="NO">7, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:41 al" default="NO">9, 4, 41 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellus me imprudente et invito excidit,</quote> <trans><tr>escaped me without my knowledge or desire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox horrenda per auras excidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et pariter vultusque deo plectrumque colorque Excidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 602</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:176" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 176</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quodammodo victoria e manibus excideret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(versus) qui in breves excidunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>which close</tr>, <tr>terminate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:106" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 106</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: in vitium libertas excidit, qs. <hi rend="ital">falls away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sinks</hi>, = delabitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 282</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16673.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. * </sense><sense id="n16673.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To dissent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">differ from</hi> any one's opinion: ego ab Archilocho excido, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 301, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16673.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be lost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim verendum est, ne quid excidat aut ne quid in terram defluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo miser excidit aevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7, 7</bibl></cit> (4, 6, 7 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec vera virtus, cum semel excidit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at non ingenio quaesitum nomen ab aevo Excidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit> (4, 1, 64 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">excidit omnis luctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne Tarentinae quidem arcis excidit memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. the foll.—Esp. </sense><sense id="n16673.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To fail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swoon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lose one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excidit illa metu, rupitque novissima verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 5, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: ut scias quemadmodum nunquam excidam mihi, <hi rend="ital">lose control of myself</hi> (through drink), Sen. de Ira, 3, 14, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">quis me dolori reddit? quam bene excideram mihi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 589 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 589 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16673.10" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To slip out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape from the memory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excidere de memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exciderat pacis mentio ex omnium animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 188</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and pectore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o miram memoriam, Pomponi, tuam! at mihi ista exciderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:18:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 18, 46</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cogitatio, cum mihi non omnino excidisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:75" default="NO">10, 1, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 24, 20; 4 (5), 7, 15 et saep.; cf. with a <hi rend="ital">subjectclause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non excidit mihi, scripsisse me, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid? non haec varietas mira est, excidere proxima, vetera inhaerere? hesternorum immemores acta pueritiae recordari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:6" default="NO">1, 12, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:91" default="NO">4, 2, 91</bibl>; 4, 5, 2; cf. with <hi rend="ital">inf. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si calore dicendi vitare id excidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 130</bibl></cit>; and with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excidit, ut peterem, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I forgot to beg</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 139</bibl></cit>.—Rarely transf. to the person: <cit><quote lang="la">excidens,</quote> <trans><tr>who forgets</tr>, <tr>forgetful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palam moneri excidentis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16673.11" n="3" level="3"> (Ex) aliquā re, of persons, <hi rend="ital">to be deprived of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">miss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forfeit</hi> (esp. freq. since the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. not at all): ex familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxore,</quote> <trans><tr>to be disappointed of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem si non tenuit, magnis tamen excidit ausis,</quote> <trans><tr>failed in a great attempt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 328</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fine medicinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: qui apud privatos judices plus petendo formula excidissent, i. e. <hi rend="ital">who lost their suits</hi> (for the usual cadere formulā or <pb n="677" /> <cb n="EXCI" /> causā; <cit><quote lang="la">v. cado, II.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16674" type="main" key="exci_do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cīdo</orth>, <itype>īdi, īsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>caedo</etym>, <sense id="n16674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hew out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hew down</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16674.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides e terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes arbores longe lateque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">excisa enim est arbor, non evulsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: exciditur ilex (with percellunt magnas quercus), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. 194 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">arborem e stirpe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:27:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ericium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnas rupibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 428</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rubos arvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: linguam alicui, Crassus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum mulieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:8:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virilitatem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to castrate</tr>, <tr>geld</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also, se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:361" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 361</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vias per montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus rupis in antrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa anaglypta in asperitatem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wrought with raised figures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 49, § 139</bibl></cit>: exciderat eum (sc. obeliscum) rex, majusque opus in devehendo statuendove multo quam in excidendo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">cut out</hi> in the quarry, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 8, 14, § 67</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 65.—</sense><sense id="n16674.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to raze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui domos inimicorum suorum oppugnavit, excidit, incendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numantiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1</bibl></cit>. 22, 76; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Trojam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 762</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:123" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 123 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to cut to pieces</tr>, <tr>annihilate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 120, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16674.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to extirpate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 18, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">iram animis, Sen. de Ira, 3, 1: aliquem numero civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excieo: <entryFree id="n16675" type="main" key="exci^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cĭĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, v. excio <sense id="n16675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
excio: <entryFree id="n16676" type="main" key="exci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii, itum</itype> (long and short equally freq.; cf. excĭtus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:42" default="NO" valid="yes">63, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:56" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 301</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 376</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 445</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:779 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 779 al.</bibl>: <sense id="n16676.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">excītus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1215</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 675</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 642</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 338</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 384</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:635" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 635</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:239 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 239 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also acc. to cieo, ēre: excies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Trag. 300" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Trag. 300</bibl></cit> (R<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Trag. Fragm. p. 175" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Fragm. p. 175</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">exciet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> exciere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 11, 11</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> excibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">excibant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:182" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 182</bibl></cit>), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to call out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring out</hi>: exciet, excutiet, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=80:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 80, 4</bibl> Müll. (freq. in the ante-class. and post-Aug. periods; perhaps not in Cic., for in Phil. 12, 7, 16, the better reading is excussimus; v. excutio; <cit><quote lang="la">and for excita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 80</bibl>, both the MSS. and editions of Cic. have excitata). </sense><sense id="n16676.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia e Germania Britanniaque excivit segniter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem ab urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sellularii exciti (ad militiam) dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 20 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animas imis sepulcris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suem latebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Urgulaniam domo principis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est quod me excivisti ante aedes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem ad dimicandum acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volscos ad expugnandam secum Ardeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventutem Celtiberorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 24, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:146" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principibus coloniae Romam excitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exciente buccina Tritone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16676.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. objects, <hi rend="ital">to bring out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth; to call forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina per artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crepitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitum pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molem (i. e. tempestatem) in undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 790</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 665</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16676.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16676.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To rouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite; to frighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrify</hi> any one: <cit><quote lang="la">sopore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: excita anus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 36 ed. Vahl.); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: clamor subito ortus dictatorem quoque ex somno excivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno excitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mauri atque Gaetuli, ignoto et horribili sonitu repente exciti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 99:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 99, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter cetera, quae ad exciendum in Graeciam Antiochum dicere est solitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excivit ea caedes Bructeros, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis commotis excita sacris Thyias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 301</bibl></cit>; esp. freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.;</hi> see the passages quoted <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; cf. also: (juventus) privatis atque publicis largitionibus excita,<cb n="EXCI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita conscientia mentem excitam vastabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Evander concursu pastorum, excitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britanni omnium civitatium vires exciverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 29</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsuque pedum tremit excita tellus,</quote> <trans><tr>frightened</tr>, <tr>quaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 722</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 445</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16676.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi> any passion (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">terrorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tumultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 11</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
excipio: <entryFree id="n16677" type="main" key="exci^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>cēpi, ceptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>capio</etym>. <sense id="n16677.0" n="I" level="1"> (With the notion of the <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> predominating.) <hi rend="ital">To take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16677.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rarely): aliquem e mari, <hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fish out</hi>, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 293, 26</bibl> (Rep. 4, 8, 8 Baiter): <cit><quote lang="la">vidulum (e mari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:140 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 140 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens manu, forcipe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum (e vulnere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum cristasque rubentes Excipiam sorti,</quote> <trans><tr>to withdraw</tr>, <tr>exempt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 271</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16677.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16677.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: servitute exceptus, <hi rend="ital">withdrawn</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">rescued from slavery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 23, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil jam cupiditati, nihil libidini exceptum,</quote> <trans><tr>exempt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16677.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16677.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To except</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make an exception of</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hosce ego homines excipio et secerno libenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Democritus) ita sit ausus ordiri: Haec loquor de universis. Nihil excipit, de quo non profiteatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaemonii ipsi, cum omnia concedunt in amore juvenum praeter stuprum, tenui sane muro dissaepiunt id, quod excipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex talos elidi jussit conservis meis: sed me excepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Licinia lex, quae non modo eum, qui, etc.... sed etiam collegas ejus, cognatos, affines excipit, ne eis ea potestas curatiove mandetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in legal limitations,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 14, 32</bibl>; see also exceptio.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 9, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">excepi de antiquis praeter Xenophanem neminem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 39, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in summis tuis laudibus excipiant unam iracundiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia, in horreis defossa, si non sint nominatim in venditione excepta, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:76" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 76</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:77" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 77</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium mihi videor, exceptis, Crasse, vobis duobus, eloquentissimos audisse Ti. et C. Sempronios,</quote> <trans><tr>you two excepted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos hortor, ut ita virtutem locetis, ut eā exceptā nihil amicitia praestabilius esse putetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exceptā sapientiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 20</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excepto, quod non simul esses, cetera laetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excepto, si obscena nudis nominibus enuntientur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:90" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 17:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:46:2" default="NO">46, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n16677.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Jurid. t. t., said of the defendant, <hi rend="ital">to except</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a legal exception</hi> to the plaintiff's statement: <cit><quote lang="la">verum est, quod qui excipit, probare debeat, quod excipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:17" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 16, 1, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. exceptio and the authorities there cited.— </sense><sense id="n16677.7" n="b" level="4"> In an oration, a law, etc., <hi rend="ital">to express by name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make particular mention of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to state expressly</hi> (rare, and perh. not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum Graecos Italia pellerent, excepisse medicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 16</bibl></cit>: vites in tantum sublimes, ut vindemitor auctoratus rogum ac tumulum excipiat, <hi rend="ital">expressly stipulates for</hi> (in case he should fall and break his neck), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 10</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n16677.8" n="II" level="1"> (With the notion of the verb predominating.) <hi rend="ital">To take</hi> a thing to one's self (in a good or bad sense), <hi rend="ital">to catch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16677.9" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16677.10" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem paterā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 11, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e longinquo sucum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 38, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labentem excepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: se in pedes, <hi rend="ital">to take to one's feet</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">spring to the ground</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiorum extremum spiritum ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:45:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 45, § 118</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicis fluentibus auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:72:section=177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 72, § 177</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 10, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 75</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">plagae genus in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:810" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 810</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o terram illam beatam, quae hunc virum exceperit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:38:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 38, 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: hunc (Mithridatem) in timore et fuga Tigranes excepit, id de. Imp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:9:23" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> 9, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem benigno vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: hic te polenta excipiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 21 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem epulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos ex fuga dispersos excipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 35, 6</bibl></cit>. alios vagos per hiberna milites excipiebant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 29, 2</bibl>: speculator, exceptus a juvenibus <cb n="EXCI" /> mulcatur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 7, 4</bibl>: cf. Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos in pabulatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incautum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(uri) mansuefieri ne parvuli quidem excepti possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprum latitantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caprum insidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugientes feras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprum, feram venabulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 2</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16677.11" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die patenti itinere Priaticus campus eos excepit,</quote> <trans><tr>received them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva tum excepit ferum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n16677.12" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16677.13" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To come next to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to follow after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam ad radices ejus haerens excipit stomachus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 135</bibl></cit>: quinque milia passuum proxima intercedere itineris campestris; <cit><quote lang="la">inde excipere loca aspera et montuosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios alii deinceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus excipiebat Arcton,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>was turned to the north</tr>, <tr>looked towards the north</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16677.14" n="b" level="4"> In medic. lang.: aliquid aliqua re, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> something <hi rend="ital">in</hi> something, i. e. <hi rend="ital">mixed with</hi> something: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (medicamenta) excipiuntur cerato ex rosa facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 25, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6</bibl>; 12 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16677.15" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16677.16" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">catch up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to intercept</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus divinationis naturale, quod animus arripit aut excipit extrinsecus ex divinitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam vidit, illum excepisse laudem ex eo, quod,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>obtained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: subire coëgit et excipere pericula, <hi rend="ital">to take upon one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to receive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi> (the figure being taken from the reception of an enemy's blows or shots), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 9, 23</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani celeriter phalange facta impetus gladiorum exceperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 58, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim frigorum hiememque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores magnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:243" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 69, 243</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">excipimus nova illa cum favore et sollicitudine,</quote> <trans><tr>receive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba risu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta ad excipiendas hominum voluntates,</quote> <trans><tr>for taking captive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw upon one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16677.17" n="b" level="4"> Of inanim. or abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (sublicae) cum omni opere conjunctae vim fluminis exciperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid reliquis accideret, qui quosque eventus exciperent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>would befall</tr>, <tr>overtake them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 318</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16677.18" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16677.19" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To catch with the ear</hi>, esp. eagerly or secretly, <hi rend="ital">to catch up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">listen to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overhear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicto nihil facilius emittitur, nihil citius excipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 23, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:48:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 48, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">assensu populi excepta vox consulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad has excipiendas voces speculator missus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 30, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudem avidissimis auribus excipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notis quoque excipere velocissime solitum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to write down in shorthand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 9, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtivas notas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16677.20" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To follow after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to succeed</hi> a thing in time or the order of succession (cf. above, A. 2. a.): <cit><quote lang="la">tristem hiemem pestilens aestas excepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculis vitam et virtutem immortalitas excepisse dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:68:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 68, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violis succedit rosa: rosam cyanus excipit, cyanum amarantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 39, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excipit Pompilium Numam Tullus Hostilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc (locutum) Labienus excepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:87:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 87, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbulentior inde annus excepit,</quote> <trans><tr>succeeded</tr>, <tr>followed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 61, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:88:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 88, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">re cognita tantus luctus excepit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n16677.21" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolong</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam illius viri excipient omnes anni consequentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 6, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 22, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vices alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 5</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:687" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 687</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excipula: <entryFree id="n16678" type="main" key="exci^pu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excĭpŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (sc. vasa), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>excipio</etym>, <sense id="n16678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vessels for receiving liquids</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receivers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receptacles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 38, § 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in excipulis ejus fluminis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cavities</tr>, <tr>basins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 22, 38, § 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excipuum: <entryFree id="n16679" type="gloss" key="exci^pu^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excĭpŭum</orth> <itype>quod excipitur, ut prae cipuum quod ante capitur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=80:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 80, 3</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
excisatus: <entryFree id="n16680" type="hapax" key="exci_sa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excīsātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>excisus, from excīdo</etym>, <sense id="n16680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cut out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off</hi>: excisatis auribus, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 108, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excisio: <entryFree id="n16681" type="main" key="exci_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excido</etym>, <sense id="n16681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting out</hi>, <pb n="678" /> <cb n="EXCI" /> <hi rend="ital">excision.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16681.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">plagae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 30</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur. concr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the parts cut out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 12, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16681.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A destroying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Harusp. Resp. 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excisorius: <entryFree id="n16682" type="main" key="exci_so_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excīsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>excido</etym>, <sense id="n16682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for cutting out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 3, § 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excisura: <entryFree id="n16683" type="main" key="exci_su_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excīsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ex-cīdo</etym>, <sense id="n16683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cutting out</hi>, Edic. Diocl. 7, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 42.</sense></entryFree>
excisus: <entryFree id="n16684" type="main" key="exci_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from excīdo.</entryFree>
excitabilis: <entryFree id="n16685" type="hapax" key="exci^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>excito</etym>, <sense id="n16685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inciting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modulatio (with jucunda),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
excitate: <entryFree id="n16686" type="main" key="exci^ta_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excĭtātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. excito, <sense id="n16686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
excitatio: <entryFree id="n16687" type="main" key="exci^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excito</etym>, <sense id="n16687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rousing up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wakening</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 237</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excitator: <entryFree id="n16688" type="main" key="exci^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who rouses</hi> or <hi rend="ital">animates</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excitatus: <entryFree id="n16689" type="main" key="exci^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from excito.</entryFree>
excito: <entryFree id="n16690" type="main" key="exci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>excio</etym>, <sense id="n16690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to call out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">send out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rouse up</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: provoco, evoco; irrito, lacesso, invito). </sense><sense id="n16690.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: unde (Acherunte) animae excitantur obscura umbra, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem huc foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si excitatus fuerit de spectaculis,</quote> <trans><tr>turned out</tr>, <tr>expelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dormientes spectatores e somno,</quote> <trans><tr>to wake up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso, ne me e somno excitetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut dormitantes eos excitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patre excitato (opp. dormiente),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scuto offenso excitatus vigil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab inferis,</quote> <trans><tr>to summon up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 12, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:49:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 49, 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a mortuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubitavit excitare reum consularem,</quote> <trans><tr>to call upon to stand up</tr>, <tr>to call up</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 47, 195</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:174" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 174</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 47</bibl></cit>: judicem, Cels. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:104" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 104</bibl> et saep.: feras, <hi rend="ital">to rouse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scare up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervum nemorosis latibulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis leporem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 1, 31, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16690.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vapores, qui a sole ex aquis excitantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput altius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16690.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., with the accessory notion of making, forming, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">build</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstrui vetat (Plato) sepulcrum altius, quam, etc. ... nec e lapide excitari amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 27, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 40, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 52" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova sarmenta cultura excitantur,</quote> <trans><tr>are produced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 21, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascua in novalibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem,</quote> <trans><tr>to kindle up</tr>, <tr>excite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 24, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 308</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invalidas flammas admoto fomite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 776</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 549</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foculum bucca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:262" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siser stomachum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 17, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae os, stomachum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 7, § 12</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n16690.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16690.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to raise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comfort; to arouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enliven</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ab excitata fortuna ad inclinatam et prope jacentem desciscerem,</quote> <trans><tr>erected</tr>, <tr>established</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amici jacentem animum excitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>; and with this cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 8</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">animos excitare atque inflammare ad persequendi studium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos omnium ad laetitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:79:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 79, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad laborem et ad laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 24, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">languentem labentemque populum ad decus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad virtutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad audiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallos alacritate ad canendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 26, 56</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus memoriam alicui excitans,</quote> <trans><tr>reviving</tr>, <tr>renewing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum studia ad utilitates nostras allicere atque excitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salsum excitat et a taedio defendit orationem,</quote> <trans><tr>enlivens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fictiones personarum mire orationem excitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi soni cum augenda intentione excitandi (opp. temperandi),</quote> <trans><tr>to sharpen</tr>, <tr>pronounce strongly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabam acutam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 33</bibl></cit>. <cb n="EXCL" /> —</sense><sense id="n16690.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16690.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To appeal to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nos ex annalium monimentis testis excitamus eos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos testis liberalitatis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16690.8" n="2" level="3"> With the accessory idea of producing (acc. to I. B. 2.), <hi rend="ital">to found</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam docuero, quibus initiis ac fundamentis hae tantae summis in rebus laudes excitatae sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 7, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animis hominum motum dicendo vel excitare vel sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plausum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 58, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletum etiam inimicis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 57, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 594</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 18, 41</bibl></cit>: varios sermones, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantas tragoedias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim ac dolorem bonorum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 18, 45</bibl></cit> et saep. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">excĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (lit. excited, kindled; hence), <hi rend="ital">animated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loud</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">acutus et excitatus sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 37, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">schema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 71, § 182</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">excĭtāte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">vigorously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briskly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemently.</hi>—In the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgent gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 31, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamitantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excitus: <entryFree id="n16691" type="main" key="exci_^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excī^tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from excio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16692" type="spur" key="exci_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, false reading in <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 184 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, for exitu.</entryFree>
exclamatio: <entryFree id="n16693" type="main" key="excla_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exclāmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exclamo</etym>, <sense id="n16693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a loud calling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crying out</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n16693.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">acuta atque attenuata nimis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acutas vocis exclamationes vitare debemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:179" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 179</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 35, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16693.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., as a figure of rhetoric, <hi rend="ital">an exclamation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 15, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 39, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:27" default="NO">9, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:97" default="NO">9, 3, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exclamo: <entryFree id="n16694" type="main" key="excla_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-clāmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n16694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16694.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neut.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to call</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cry aloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to call</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cry out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exclaim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum exclamasset Laelius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in stadio cursores exclamant quam maxime possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">majus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contiones saepe exclamare vidi, cum apte verba cecidissent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to applaud loudly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:50:168" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 50, 168</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 45</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties exclamandum erit, lateris conatus sit ille, non capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:59" default="NO">3, 8, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16694.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16694.3" n="1" level="3"> Of inanim. and abstr. things (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">apud hunc (oratorem) patria ipsa exclamabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis exclamat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>crackles aloud</tr>, <tr>makes a noise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:202" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominae femur exclamare coëgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:423" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (verba) aut maxime exclamant, aut sono sunt jucundissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus exclamantes syllabae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 137</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16694.4" n="2" level="3"> Of a sound made with musical instruments: <cit><quote lang="la">sacris tubis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 16, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. 3, 54; 4, 40.—</sense><sense id="n16694.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to call out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say aloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exclaim.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16694.6" n="A" level="2"> With inanim. objects. </sense><sense id="n16694.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, in oratio recta: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi nescio quis maxima Voce exclamat: Alcumena, adest auxilium, ne time,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non possum quin exclamem: Euge, euge, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 79</bibl></cit> (quoted <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 10, 39</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">mihi libet exclamare, Pro deum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 13 al.</bibl>—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic exclamat, eum sibi esse sodalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16694.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (geometricas formas) ut vidisset, exclamavisse, ut bono essent animo, videre enim se hominum vestigia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut equites desilirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 38, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16694.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam,</quote> <trans><tr>to utter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa memoria digna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16694.10" n="B" level="2"> With personal objects, <hi rend="ital">to call upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce clara exclamat uxorem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: M. Brutus cruentum pugionem tenens Ciceronem exclamavit, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem suo nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exclaro: <entryFree id="n16695" type="hapax" key="excla_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-clāro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to light up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illumine</hi> (opp. obscurare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
