excludo: <entryFree id="n16696" type="main" key="exclu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-clūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n16696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. sync.</hi> exclusti for exclusisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 18</bibl>) [cludo, claudo], <hi rend="ital">to shut out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exclude; to cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi> from any thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n16696.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16696.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: aliquem a portu et <cb n="EXCO" /> perfugio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab re frumentaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:55:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 55, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 41, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaditani Poenos moenibus excluserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla exclusura dolentes Janua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:73" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 73</bibl></cit>.—With inanimate objects: <cit><quote lang="la">spissa ramis laurea fervidos Excludet ictus (solis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam quae exundante palude in agrum refluere solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exclusere diem telis,</quote> <trans><tr>shut out</tr>, <tr>obscured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:412" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euphrates Armeniae regiones a Cappadocia excludens,</quote> <trans><tr>separating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 20, § 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16696.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to shut out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse to receive</hi> a visitor: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pacto excludi, quaeso, potis est planius, quam exclusus nunc sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego excludor, ille recipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae me non excludet ab se, sed apud se occludet domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 108</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ab illa excludar, huc concludar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 260</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 78</bibl>; cf.: priusquam Caesar me abs te excludere posset, Pomp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl> B. 1.—</sense><sense id="n16696.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16696.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To drive out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">take out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excludito mihi hercle oculum, si dedero,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to knock out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel oculum exclude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:4:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 84" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallio caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 32, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16696.6" n="b" level="4"> In partic. of birds, <hi rend="ital">to hatch</hi> their young: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres Ova relinquebant, exclusae tempore verno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:802" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 802</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae avesque reliquae, cum ex ovis pullos excluserint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 48, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:11" default="NO">8, 14, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14 al.</bibl>—And transf., by way of pun, to the pupils of the rhetorician Corax (raven): <cit><quote lang="la">Coracem istum patiamur pullos suos excludere in nido, qui evolent, clamatores odiosi ac molesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:21:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 21, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16696.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make prominent</hi> (eccl. Lat.), = eminere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 67:section=39" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 67, § 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:67:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 67, 31</bibl>; cf. Aug. Spir. et Litt. § 17.—* </sense><sense id="n16696.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2 praef" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense><sense id="n16696.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to exclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">except</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crassus tres legatos decernit, nec excludit Pompeium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excludi ab omni doctrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exclusit illum a re publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hereditate fraterna excludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 11, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: ne anni tempore a navigatione excluderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut reditu in Asiam excluderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exceptione excludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multas actiones praetoriis exceptionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:19:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 19, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustiis temporis excluduntur omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempore exclusus,</quote> <trans><tr>hindered</tr>, <tr>prevented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diei tempore exclusus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui se in hoc judicium forte projecerint, excluditote eorum cupiditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: servitutem, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 301, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinem libere dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 19</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">exclūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">shut out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">locked out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ego sum exclusissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 3, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exclusio: <entryFree id="n16697" type="main" key="exclu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exclūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excludo</etym>, <sense id="n16697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shutting out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exclusion</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): de exclusione verbum nullum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exceptio est quasi quaedam exclusio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exclusor: <entryFree id="n16698" type="main" key="exclu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exclūsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>excludo, I. B.</etym>, <sense id="n16698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who shuts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drives out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">daemoniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 37:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 37, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Verb. Dom. 2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Verb. Dom. 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16698.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a maker of silver vessels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui de confusione massae noverunt formam vasis exprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 67:section=39" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 67, § 39</bibl></cit>; id. Spir. et Litt. § 17.</sense></entryFree>
exclusorius: <entryFree id="n16699" type="main" key="exclu_so_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exclūsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>excludo</etym>, <sense id="n16699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exclusory</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exceptio, replicatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:2:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 1, 2, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exclusus: <entryFree id="n16700" type="main" key="exclu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exclūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from excludo.</entryFree>
excoctio: <entryFree id="n16701" type="main" key="excocti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excoctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excoquo</etym>, <sense id="n16701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boiling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">baking thoroughly</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">calcis,</quote> <trans><tr>a burning</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <trans><tr>a baking</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 39, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excoctus: <entryFree id="n16702" type="main" key="excoctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excoctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from excoquo.</entryFree>
excodico: <entryFree id="n16703" type="main" key="exco_di^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excōdĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. excaudico.</entryFree>
excogitatio: <entryFree id="n16704" type="main" key="exco_gi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excōgĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excogito</etym>, <sense id="n16704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thinking out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contriving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inventing</hi> (syn. inventio): <cit><quote lang="la">quid? illa vis quae tandem est, quae investigat occulta, quae inventio atque excogitatio dicitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 61</bibl></cit>: excogitationem non habent difficilem, <hi rend="ital">may be thought out without difficulty</hi>,<pb n="679" /> <cb n="EXCO" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum malae artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 15, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excogitator: <entryFree id="n16705" type="main" key="exco_gi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excōgĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contriver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inventor</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">verborum et nominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excogitatus: <entryFree id="n16706" type="main" key="exco_gi^ta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excōgĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from excogito.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16707" type="spur" key="excogitatus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excogitatus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, false reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, instead of excogitatae.</entryFree>
excogito: <entryFree id="n16708" type="main" key="exco_gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cōgĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to find out by thinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to contrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invent</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">comminiscor, simulo, confingo, fingo, etc.): quid enim mali aut sceleris fingi aut excogitari potest, quod non ille conceperit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec igitur cogita, mi Attice, vel potius excogita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid igitur causae excogitari potest, cur? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novam interregni ineundi rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid dignum dono deorum aut efficere aut excogitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa praeterea generatim ad avaritiam excogitabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ad ornatum portarum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:51:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 51, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o callidos homines! o rem excogitatam!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:67:225" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 67, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid omnino excogitari contra potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ab illis dicta, non a nobis excogitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rebus excogitandis (opp. gerendis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Impers.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excogitatum est a quibusdam ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 8, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. with a <hi rend="ital">subject-sentence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum recenti fico salis vice caseo vesci nuper excogitatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 19, 21, § 82</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n16708.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes Poeninas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">excōgĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">sought out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excogitatissimae hostiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excolo: <entryFree id="n16709" type="main" key="exco^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cŏlo</orth>, <itype>cŏlŭi, cultum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to work carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16709.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare, and mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vineas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 48</bibl></cit>; cf. rura, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 196</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victum hominum (boves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 47, 72, § 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanas rudes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to spin fine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 220</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16709.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to improve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmora, quibus solum, quibus parietes excolantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 39, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 118</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praetoria xystis et nemoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem adeo, ut jure sit gloriatus marmoream se relinquere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructuarius excolere quod invenit potest, qualitate aedium non immutata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13:section=7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 1, 13, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagos resecare capillos Doctus et hirsutas excoluisse genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:52:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 52, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulum in tropaei modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionarii injecere flammae arma sua, quibus exculti funus celebrabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16709.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16709.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To improve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ennoble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfect</hi> (the class. signif. of the word): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam horridum, tam incultum, quod non splendescat oratione et tamquam excolatur, Cic. Parad. prooem. § 3: C. Tuditanus omni vita atque victu excultus atque expolitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 25, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mansuefactus et excultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex agresti immanique vita exculti ad humanitatem et mitigati sumus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excultus doctrinā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 38, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos doctrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia disciplinā exculta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:15:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas exculta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus rebus exculta hominum vita tantum distat a victu et cultu bestiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventas aut qui vitam excoluere per artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 663</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an victus hominum Atheniensium beneficio excoli potuit, oratio non potuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mores aut studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">3: mores studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:1" default="NO">12, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">excultae cujusdam elegantiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16709.5" n="B" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to honor</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and very rare, for the class. colere): <cit><quote lang="la">deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 1, 7, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16710" type="main" key="exco_lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cōlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strain out</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">acetum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:23:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 23, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excomedo: <entryFree id="n16711" type="hapax" key="exco^me^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cŏmĕdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to eat up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excommunicatio: <entryFree id="n16712" type="main" key="excommu_ni^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excommūnĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excommunico</etym>, <sense id="n16712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ban of the Church</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excommunication</hi>, Aug. de Fide, 3 et saep.</sense></entryFree>
excommunico: <entryFree id="n16713" type="main" key="excommu_ni^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-commūnĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (lit., to put out of the community; hence, <cb n="EXCR" /> in eccl. Lat.), <sense id="n16713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay under the ban of the Church</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to excommunicate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Ruf. 2, 18</bibl>: aliquem excommunicatum habere, Hilar. Op. Hist. Fragm. 11, 4.</sense></entryFree>
excondo: <entryFree id="n16714" type="main" key="excondo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-condo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excongruus: <entryFree id="n16715" type="main" key="excongru^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-congrŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n16715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not agreeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not harmonious</hi>: laus, Symm. Or. pro Syn. 5 ed. Mai.</sense></entryFree>
exconsularis: <entryFree id="n16716" type="gloss" key="exconsu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-consŭlāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has been a consul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ex-consul</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 151, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excoquo: <entryFree id="n16717" type="main" key="exco^quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cŏquo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to boil out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">melt out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dry up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16717.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque coquito, dum dimidium excoquas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>you boil away</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 107, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustum ad dimidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudinem vino,</quote> <trans><tr>to boil thoroughly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 4, 14, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebas melle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 12, 74, § 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum (ignis),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to harden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 712</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenas admixto nitro in vitrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapide cremato in caminis donec excoquatur in rubricam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 37, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis vitium metallis excoquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:786" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 786</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne per ignes vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 88</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, excoctum argentum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>purified</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:5:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">excoxi te, non quasi argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:48:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 48, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imagines excoctae flammis,</quote> <trans><tr>melted down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:52:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 52, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excoctum parum habet suci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=109" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 109</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">terram sol excoquit et facit are,</quote> <trans><tr>dries up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:962" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 962</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tam excoctam (ancillam) reddam atque atram quam carbo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 63</bibl></cit>.—With an abstr. object: cruditatem Laconicis, qs. <hi rend="ital">to boil out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to drive out by steam-baths</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">16: excocta maturitas hordei,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>overripe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 18, § 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16717.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to devise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit> (cf. coquo): <cit><quote lang="la">mentem,</quote> <trans><tr>to plague</tr>, <tr>vex</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 105" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 105</bibl></cit> (cf. coquo).</sense></entryFree>
excorio: <entryFree id="n16718" type="main" key="exco^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cŏrĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>corium</etym>, <sense id="n16718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strip of its skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strip</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 10, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Micah, 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16718.1" n="II" level="1"> In mal. part., <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 717</bibl> Oud. dub.; cf. Hildebr. ed. min. p. 137, note 3.</sense></entryFree>
excornis: <entryFree id="n16719" type="hapax" key="excornis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cornis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cornu</etym>, <sense id="n16719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without horns</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excors: <entryFree id="n16720" type="main" key="excors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cors</orth>, <itype>cordis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cor, the heart, as the seat of intelligence; v. cor</etym>, <sense id="n16720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without intelligence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amens, demens, vecors, insanus, vesanus, delirus): aliis cor ipsum animus videtur: ex quo excordes, vecordes, concordesque dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">an quod aspexit (taurus) vestitu purpureo excordem Caesarem, ipse corde privatus est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excors, caecus, incogitabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae anus tam excors inveniri potest, quae illa extimescat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc qui non videt, excors est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">aperte adulantem nemo non videt, nisi qui admodum est excors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpis et excors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tune insanus eris, si acceperis? an magis excors Rejecta praeda?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excrementum: <entryFree id="n16721" type="main" key="excre_mentum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excrēmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>excerno</etym>. <sense id="n16721.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">What is sifted out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the refuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 26, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Nov. 20, 4</bibl>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n16721.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">What passes from the body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excrement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 26, 32, § 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:147" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 45, 68, § 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <trans><tr>spittle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narium,</quote> <trans><tr>mucus of the nose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 16, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16722" type="main" key="excre_mentum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excrēmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>excresco</etym>, <sense id="n16722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an elevation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prominence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilior inter excrementa costarum spina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n16722.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of numbers which increase regularly in series: <cit><quote lang="la">sic decem milia ceteraque excrementa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 734</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excremo: <entryFree id="n16723" type="main" key="excre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-crĕmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to burn</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excreo: <entryFree id="n16724" type="main" key="excreo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-creo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. exscreo.</entryFree>
excrescentia: <entryFree id="n16725" type="main" key="excrescenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excrescentĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. excresco, B. 2.</entryFree>
excresco: <entryFree id="n16726" type="main" key="excresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cresco</orth>, <itype>crēvi, crētum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n16726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rise up</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n16726.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16726.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si satis excreverint (palmae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abies, larix, palma in longitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 30, 54, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactucae ad semipedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 39, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni domo nudi ac sordidi in hos artus, in haec corpora quae miramur excrescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 216:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 216, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles sensim excreverant rudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 18" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum tumulo in altum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 11</bibl></cit>: si quando flumen imbribus<cb n="EXCU" />  ad tempus excrevit, <hi rend="ital">is swollen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:11:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 11, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16726.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of morbid excrescences on the body: <cit><quote lang="la">excreverat in dexteriore latere ejus caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnis excrescentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 6, 59, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arsenicum tollit quicquid excrescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 18, 56, § 178</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n16726.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">excre-scentia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, in medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">morbid excrescences</hi> on the body, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 36, § 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:61" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 21, 29, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 4, 5, § 9</bibl>; 24, 5, 11, § 19; 34, 18, 50, § 169 al.—</sense><sense id="n16726.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow immoderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec minus evitanda est immodica ejus prooemii longitudo, ne in caput excrevisse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus in tantum excrevit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:27:section=16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 27, § 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litium series,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-crētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">grown up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fullgrown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> al. (so, haedi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 398</bibl>, acc. to Serv., but v. excerno, II. A.).</sense></entryFree>
excretus: <entryFree id="n16727" type="main" key="excre_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excrētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n16727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">separated; Part.</hi>, from excerno.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16728" type="main" key="excre_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excrētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n16728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grown up; P. a.</hi>, from excresco.</sense></entryFree>
excruciabilis: <entryFree id="n16729" type="main" key="excru^ci^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excrŭcĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>excrucio</etym>. * <sense id="n16729.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deserving of torture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n16729.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tormenting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torturing</hi>: exitium, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 114.</sense></entryFree>
excruciatio: <entryFree id="n16730" type="main" key="excru^ci^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excrŭcĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torture</hi>, = cruciatus (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Joann. 27" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Joann. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
excruciator: <entryFree id="n16731" type="main" key="excru^ci^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excrŭcĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tormentor</hi>: cordis, corporis, August. cont. Gaudent. 1, 21.</sense></entryFree>
excruciatus: <entryFree id="n16732" type="main" key="excru^ci^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excrŭcĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torture</hi>, = cruciatus (post-class.): duri corporis, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 14, 19.</sense></entryFree>
excrucio: <entryFree id="n16733" type="main" key="excru^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-crŭcĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (archaic <sense id="n16733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. praes.</hi> excruciarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 4</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to torment greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plague</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16733.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically: <cit><quote lang="la">perii! excruciabit me herus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos fame vinculisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(uxores) igni atque omnibus tormentis excruciatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vinculis ac verberibus atque omni supplicio excruciatum necare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: hominem ingenuum fumo excruciatum semivivum reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:17:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excruciatus inopiā, Plaut Bacch. 3, 4, 24: ipsos crudeliter excruciatos interficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus nudos excruciabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1426</bibl></cit> et saep.—Comic. <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Hunc tibi dedo diem. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Meam culpam habeto, nisi probe excruciavero, qs. <hi rend="ital">thoroughly torture it</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">use it up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make the most of it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16733.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to force out by torturing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">re excruciatā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n16733.3" n="II" level="1"> Mentally, <hi rend="ital">to afflict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>: conficior maerore, mea Terentia; <cit><quote lang="la">nec meae me miseriae magis excruciant quam tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non loquor plura, ne te quoque excruciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt, quae me excruciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—In imprecations: <cit><quote lang="la">di deaeque te excrucient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritas et libido et ignavia semper animum excruciant et semper sollicitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illam miseram animi excrucias?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 76</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Antipho me excruciat animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; v. also in the foll.—In the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excrucior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ego excrucior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sese excruciat animi, Quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excubatio: <entryFree id="n16734" type="main" key="excu^ba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excŭbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excubo</etym>, <sense id="n16734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keeping watch.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n16734.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab excubatione desistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:3:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n16734.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetua pro dignitate et salute amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excubiae: <entryFree id="n16735" type="main" key="excu^bi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excŭbĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lying out of the house.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16735.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 54</bibl>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n16735.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a lying out on guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a watching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keeping watch</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">custodia, vigiliae, insomnia): si haec arma, si Capitolinae cohortes, si excubiae, si vigiliae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 25, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 9, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 42, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 159</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tristes (i. e. severae) vigilum canum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grues excubias habent nocturnis temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 30, § 59</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: centum <pb n="680" /> <cb n="EXCU" /> aras posuit vigilemque sacraverat ignem, Excubias divum aeternas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 200</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n16735.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">persons keeping watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">num excubias transiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter excubias militum pernoctavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excubicularius: <entryFree id="n16736" type="main" key="excu^bi^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cŭbĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ex-chamberlain</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 47, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excubitor: <entryFree id="n16737" type="main" key="excu^bi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excŭbĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>excubo</etym>, <sense id="n16737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who keeps guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a watchman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentinel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec eadem (castella) noctu excubitoribus ac firmis praesidiis tenebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunus excubitor,</quote> <trans><tr>the captain of the guard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 8</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of a dog: quis excubitor inveniri potest vigilantior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of a cock: <cit><quote lang="la">excubitor ales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excubitorium: <entryFree id="n16738" type="main" key="excu^bi^to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excŭbĭtōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a post where guards were stationed</hi>, P. Victor. de Reg. Urb. Rom. <hi rend="ital">sub fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
excubitus: <entryFree id="n16739" type="hapax" key="excu^bi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excŭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keeping watch</hi>: in excubitu, Auct. B. Hisp. 6, 4.</sense></entryFree>
excubo: <entryFree id="n16740" type="main" key="excu^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cŭbo</orth>, <itype>bŭi, bĭtum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n16740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lie</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sleep out of doors.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16740.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">moniti Lacedaemonii, ut urbem et tecta linquerent armatique in agro excubarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:50:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 50, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes noctu deprehensae in expeditione excubant supinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 8, 8, § 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16740.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeciam alienis sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 4, 7</bibl></cit>, v. Fittbogen ad h. l.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n16740.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to lie out on guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to watch.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16740.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae semper legiones pro castris excubabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones in armis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones ad mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 63, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes ad munitionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio per muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excubitum in porta cohortes mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 100, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cerberus excubat ante fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:72" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (naves) ad portum excubabant,</quote> <trans><tr>kept watch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 22, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cupido Chiae) Pulchris excubat in genis,</quote> <trans><tr>sits on the watch</tr>, <tr>lurks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 8</bibl></cit>.—Of things as subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">alni contra erumpentium amnium impetus riparum muro in tutela ruris excubant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 67, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus ante limina excubat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16740.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be watchful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vigilant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be on the alert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Caesar ad opus consuetudine excubaret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in navibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excubabo vigilaboque pro vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens semper animo sic excubat, ut nihil ei improvisum accidere possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 37</bibl></cit>: curam rei publicae summae defendundae jam pridem apud vos excubare, <hi rend="ital">is watchful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">active</hi>, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis eorum ars urbibus excubabat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>was concerned</tr>, <tr>labored for the cities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 118</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum, non animi pretiis excubatur,</quote> <trans><tr>care is exercised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 7, 32, § 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excudo: <entryFree id="n16741" type="main" key="excu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cūdo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hammer out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16741.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">silici scintillam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 77, § 208</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16741.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hatch out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullos ex ovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 129</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:10" default="NO">10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:13" default="NO">13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anseres aliena ova non excudunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>do not hatch them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:10:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; § 4; 3, 9, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16741.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To forge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mould</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excudent alii spirantia mollius aera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:848" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 848</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16741.4" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ceras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16741.5" n="D" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of a writing, <hi rend="ital">to compose</hi>: excudam aliquid <foreign lang="greek">*(hraklei/deion</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> de Or. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exculcator: <entryFree id="n16742" type="main" key="exculca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exculcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exculco</etym>, milit. t. t., <sense id="n16742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a skirmisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scout</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exculcatus: <entryFree id="n16743" type="main" key="exculca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exculcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exculco.</entryFree>
exculco: <entryFree id="n16744" type="main" key="exculco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-culco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> <etym>calco</etym>, <sense id="n16744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tread</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beat out</hi> (very rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n16744.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex dominis meis pugnis furfures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n16744.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to tread down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stamp firm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">close</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">singuli ab infimo solo pedes terra exculcabantur,</quote> <trans><tr>rammed down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 7</bibl></cit> Oud.— Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">exculcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (trodden out, worn out by treading; trop.), <hi rend="ital">worn out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba nimis obsoleta exculcataque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excultor: <entryFree id="n16745" type="main" key="excultor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excultor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. excolo</etym>, <sense id="n16745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cultivator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rearer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">florum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannicae crudelitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 2, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excultus: <entryFree id="n16746" type="main" key="excultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. excolo. <cb n="EXCU" /></entryFree>
excuneatus: <entryFree id="n16747" type="hapax" key="excu^ne^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cŭnĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cuneus</etym>, <sense id="n16747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crowded out of the seats in the theatre; that can not get a seat</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 353, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excuratus: <entryFree id="n16748" type="main" key="excu_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [curo], <sense id="n16748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">carefully attended to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taken good care of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepide excuratus incessisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus,</quote> <trans><tr>carefully provided</tr>, <tr>exquisite</tr>, <tr>choice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excurio: <entryFree id="n16749" type="main" key="excu_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cūrĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>curia</etym>, <sense id="n16749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">io eject from the curia</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from the senate</hi> (anteclass.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 36, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">465, 27</bibl> ex conject.</sense></entryFree>
excurro: <entryFree id="n16750" type="main" key="excurro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-curro</orth>, <itype>cŭcurri</itype> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 15</bibl> et saep.; <sense id="n16750.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">less freq. curri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 30</bibl></cit>), <itype>cursum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16750.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neut.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to run out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten forwards.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16750.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se excucurrisse illuc frustra sciverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excurrat aliquis, qui hoc tantum mali filio suo nuntiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandavi utrique eorum, ut ante ad me excurrerent, ut tibi obviam prodire possem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: excurristi a Neapoli, Caes. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 901</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum panes et cetera in navem parantur, excurro in Pompeianum,</quote> <trans><tr>make an excursion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of a long journey: in Graeciam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of eagerness in applauding a speaker: proni atque succincti ad omnem clausulam non exsurgunt modo, verum etiam excurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in crucem,</quote> <trans><tr>to go to destruction</tr>, <tr>go to the devil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hominem Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16750.3" n="b" level="4"> In partic., milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to sally forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make an excursion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">irruption</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine signis omnibus portis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 34, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fines Romanos excucurrerunt populandi magis quam justi more belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthago excurrere ex Africa videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excursurus cum valida manu fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16750.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. or abstr. things. </sense><sense id="n16750.5" n="a" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to go forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">issue forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons ex summo montis cacumine excurrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec recisis qui a lateribus excurrant pampinis,</quote> <trans><tr>shoot forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum animi spretis corporibus evolant atque excurrunt foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:50:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 50, 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16750.6" n="b" level="4"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16750.7" n="(a)" level="5"> Of localities, <hi rend="ital">to run out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">project</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab intimo sinu paeninsula excurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 42, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicania tribus excurrit in aequora linguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 724</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promontorium in altum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 23, 10</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">dorsum montis in Persidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promontorium per Creticum mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16750.8" n="(b)" level="5"> In specifications of measure, <hi rend="ital">to be over and above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exceed</hi> (late Lat.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Krebs, Antibarb. p. 435): decem (auri pondo) et quod excurrit,</quote> <trans><tr>and something over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viginti et quod excurrit annorum pax,</quote> <trans><tr>of twenty years and upwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 28</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n16750.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to run</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display itself</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus, in quo excurrere virtus posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: quid est, cur insistere orationem malint quam cum sententia pariter excurrere? qs. <hi rend="ital">to keep pace with</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:170" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 51, 170</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne oratio excurrat longius,</quote> <trans><tr>to run out to too great length</tr>, <tr>be prolix</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra ordinem excurrens tractatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paeone dochmioque, quorum prior in quatuor, secundus in quinque (syllabas) excurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecoces germinationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 16</bibl></cit>: in hos quoque studiorum secessus excurrit, qs. <hi rend="ital">makes excursions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia in hoc tempus excurrit donationis eventus, quo,</quote> <trans><tr>extends</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: quaedam (in periodo) quasi decurtata ... productiora alia et quasi immoderatius excurrentia, <hi rend="ital">running out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stretched out</hi> (the figure being taken from places which run out or project, v. above), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:53:178" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 53, 178</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16750.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To run out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terminate</hi>, of verses: <cit><quote lang="la">in quatuor syllabas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16750.11" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n16750.12" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To run through</hi> a place; <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: prope jam excurso spatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 210</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16750.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omit</hi> something in speaking: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo multa improbe sed venuste dicta, ne modum excedam, excurro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 34 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>, p. 374 Bip.</sense></entryFree>
excursatio: <entryFree id="n16751" type="main" key="excursa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cursātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>curso</etym>, <sense id="n16751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">onset</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excursator: <entryFree id="n16752" type="main" key="excursa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cursātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. In milit. lang., <sense id="n16752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a skirmisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scout</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excursio: <entryFree id="n16753" type="main" key="excursi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excursĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excurro</etym>, <sense id="n16753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running</hi> <cb n="EXCU" /> <hi rend="ital">out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16753.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16753.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">status (oratoris) erectus et celsus: excursio moderata eaque rara,</quote> <trans><tr>a stepping forwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nec vultu nec manu nec excursionibus nimius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an intentione rei familiaris obeundae crebris excursionibus avocaris?</quote> <trans><tr>excursions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longinquae aut breves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16753.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a sally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">onset</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack; an excursion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invasion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebras ex oppido excursiones faciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae, quibus fines suos ab excursionibus hostium et latrociniis tueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via excursionibus barbarorum infesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov.
