G. 1, 31, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne viderem, quae futura exempla dicunt in eum indigna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet aliquid ex iniquo omne magnum exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meritum quidem novissima exempla Mithridatem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the punishment of death</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in exemplo,</quote> <trans><tr>to serve as a warning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 454</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judae, 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplo supplicii reliquos deterrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:44:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 44, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16796.10" n="4" level="3"> Law t. t., <hi rend="ital">a precedent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad exemplum trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui sine exemplo subvenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16796.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi more isto atque exemplo vivunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">negat se more et exemplo populi Romani posse iter ulli per provinciam dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno exemplo ne omnes vitam viverent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istoc exemplo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot me exemplis ludificatust,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem exemplo, quo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hoc exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 76</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence often of <hi rend="ital">methods</hi> or <hi rend="ital">examples</hi> of punishment (cf. 3. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">quando ego te exemplis pessumis cruciavero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus exemplis crucior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 67</bibl>.—Freq. of the <hi rend="ital">tenor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purport</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contents</hi> of a letter, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae uno exemplo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the same tenor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere bis eodem exemplo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum duplex ... sed eodem exemplo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capua litterae sunt allatae hoc exemplo: Pompeius mare transiit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(litterarum) exemplum componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 20, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
